content.rendered:
Everybody Knows:
You can’t be all things to all people.
You can’t do all things at once.
You can’t do all things equally well.
You can’t do all things better than everyone else.
Your humanity is showing just like everyone else’s.

So:
You have to find out who you are, and be that.
You have to decide what comes first, and do that.
You have to discover your strengths, and use them.
You have to learn not to compete with others,
Because no one else is in the contest of *being you*.

Then:
You will have learned to accept your own uniqueness.
You will have learned to set priorities and make decisions.
You will have learned to live with your limitations.
You will have learned to give yourself the respect that is due.
And you’ll be a most vital mortal.

Dare To Believe:
That you are a wonderful, unique person.
That you are a once-in-all-history event.
That it’s more than a right, it’s your duty, to be who you are.
That life is not a problem to solve, but a gift to cherish.
And you’ll be able to stay one up on what used to get you down.

Please teach me; Lord…I want to know exactly how to pray.
I need some words which ones are right? Please tell me what to say.

I’ve bowed my head I have knelt down, but… should I be upright?
I’ve closed my eyes, I’ve raised my hands, or… should I fold them tight?

Are lights turned on or are they off? May be… candle light?

Should I whisper? Speak out loud? I feel confused & unable

I’m new at this what are the rules? I want to do it right.
How do I know You’ll even hear that I am in Your sight?

“Oh, dearest child of mine… Do you think I really care about the time of day?
Or whether you are standing up, or kneeling when you pray?”

Just open up your soul to me, I have no other rules.
Tell me what is in your heart, and tell me what you seek;
Tell me of your sorrows, And of those things that made you weak.”

“Speak to me in private about what concerns you most;
I know about your good deeds…you have no need to boast.
My child, you don’t need lessons, just talk to me each day;
Tell me anything you want, dear child, anyone can pray.”

Little Bobby came into the kitchen where his mother was making dinner.His birthday was coming up and he thought this was a good time to tell his mother what he wanted.

“Mom, I want a bike for my birthday.” Little Bobby was a bit of a troublemaker.
He had gotten into trouble at school and at home. Bobby’s mother asked him if he thought he deserved to get a bike for his birthday. Little Bobby, of course, thought he did.

Bobby’s mother wanted Bobby to reflect on his behavior over the last year.
“Go to your room, Bobby, and think about how you have behaved this year.

Then write a letter to God and tell him why you deserve a bike for your birthday.” Little Bobby stomped up the steps to his room and sat down to write God a letter.

Letter 1
Dear God,
I have been a very good boy this year and I would like a bike for my birthday. I want a red one.
Your friend,
Bobby

Bobby knew that this wasn’t true. He had not been a very good boy this year,
so he tore up the letter and started over.

Letter 2
Dear God,
This is your friend Bobby. I have been a good boy this year and I would like a red bike for my birthday.
Thank you.
Your friend Bobby

Bobby knew that this wasn’t true either. So, he tore up the letter and started again.

Letter 3
Dear God,
I have been an “OK “boy this year. I still would really like a bike for my birthday.
Bobby

Bobby knew he could not send this letter to God either. So, Bobby wrote a fourth letter.

Letter 4
God,
I know I haven’t been a good boy this year. I am very sorry. I will be a good boy if you just send me a bike for my birthday. Please!
Thank you,
Bobby

Bobby knew, even if it was true, this letter was not going to get ! him a bike.

Now, Bobby was very upset. He went downstairs and told his mom that he wanted to go to church. Bobby’s mother thought her plan had worked, as Bobby looked very sad.”Just be home in time for dinner,” Bobby’s mother told him.

Bobby walked down the street to the church on the corner. Little Bobby went into the church and up to the altar. He looked around to see if anyone was there. Bobby bent down and picked up a statue of the Mary. He slipped
the statue under his shirt and ran out of the church, down the street, into the house, and up to his room. He shut the door to his ! room and sat down
with a piece of paper and a pen. Bobby began to write his letter to God.

Letter 5
God,
I’VE KIDNAPPED YOUR MAMA. IF YOU WANT TO SEE HER AGAIN, SEND THE BIKE! !!!!!!!

Good morning,

2Kings 4:1-6, “… go, borrow vessels from everywhere, from all your neighbors-empty vessels; do not gather just a few…”

In light of devotions on prayers I have been sharing, I would like to share a message I shared in 2002. I pray you will be blessed

Naturally man is selfish knowingly or unknowingly, that is the nature of man. We always come for us, it’s always about what we can get, how to get it and how we are going to benefit from it. A woman is introduced to us in the text, her husband is dead and she has two sons. For some unknown reasons, her husband owed some creditors and they are out to take her sons to be slaves. This does sound like something that does happen in the world, as long as one has what he’s owed, he is satisfied. It does not matter whether the other party is suffering or not. It’s good to receive what is owed but how one deals and acts on it will determine how dignified they are.

She is out crying to the Elisha and all she can say is that her husband feared the Lord. All you’ve got is all you need to get the job done. “… Tell me what do you have in your house?…” is the question Elisha asks, and the woman’s response is amazing,  “Nothing but a little oil in jar” that’s her answer. She is not hiding anything, she is transparent. If we are going to get anything from the Lord, we have to be transparent by what we have. She may have hoped for the man of God to call heaven and a miracle would happen. Instead she is given another instruction, “go borrow vessels from everywhere, from all your neighbors and friends, empty vessels and let them not be few is the advice she does get. How can one borrow vessels when there is only very little in a jar, and the vessels borrowed are not even filled vessels, they are empty vessels. Being obedient to the word of the prophets is the beginning of blessings. They borrowed vessels until they could not borrow anymore, after that they went in, closed the door behind them and poured little oil in every vessel and as they did that, God filled all the vessels they poured little oil in. Interesting thing, the little oil from the jar was not running out.

What I’m I talking about here? Prayers is the little oil that we’ve got and the empty vessels are the people around us who need our prayers. Friends, neighbors, family members need it and the moment we begin to borrow these vessels, we are getting to a place where we just don’t think about ourselves and how we can get more blessings from the Lord but we begin to pray for those who are struggling, have nothing, weak, sick and the like. There are certain times when God allows us to go through something as a reminder that there is someone else who is going through the same thing. Why pray for them? because you know how to get blessings from God and they don’t’.  You put little oil in those empty vessels, God will fill those vessels and what He has done for others, He will do the same for you. At times forget about what you go through, what you don’t have and the like and remember that there is someone out there whose condition is worse than yours. Thank God for the little oil in your jar, you can pour it into many vessels an not run out. The more you pour the more God will increase you life too. Always remember to borrow more vessels. Take care of God’s business and He will take care of yours. There is power that flows when one borrows vessels. Job 42:10, “And the Lord restored Job’s losses when He prayed (poured little oil of prayer) for (in) His friends”

blessings
Evans

Good morning,

James 5:16,”Confess to one another therefore your faults (your slips, your false steps, your offenses, your sins) and pray [also] for one another, that you may be healed and restored [to a spiritual tone of mind and heart]. The earnest (heartfelt, continued) prayer of a righteous man makes tremendous power available [dynamic in its working]” (Amplified)

One of the things that hinder our prayers from reaching our heavenly Father is un forgiveness. Either we’ve not confessed our sins to the Father that He may forgive us or  we have not forgiven someone else who has wronged us or both. It’s not that the prayers reach the Father then He doesn’t act on it, it’s the prayers being blocked by un forgiveness that it may not reach the Father.

It’s possible to be offended, Jesus said in Luke 17:1, “It is impossible that no offenses should come” (NKV)”, we are human, we are pruned to mistakes and offenses. With that in mind, I hope that I will not offend or be offended but know in the back of my mind that it can and will happen. The question is, how do I deal with it when it comes. In my own life, I have placed my confidence in no man because I know men can fail. It’s now easier for me to forgive, after all, God in Christ Jesus has forgiven me for wronging Him over and over again. Why should I have something against my brother? Why would I want to hinder my prayers from reaching the Father because of un forgiveness? My flesh would want to give them a dose of their own medicine, revenge, make them feel the way I have felt, the only thing is that it robs me of freedom I need. When offended and cannot forgive, the un forgiveness steals such a great strength out of you and leaves you powerless. This means the un forgiveness has controlling power over you.

James says, confess it, deal with your un forgiveness then pray for the one you have forgiven. Now this is hard but I believe the key release to your blessings depends on whether you can release and pray for the one you are releasing. Didn’t Jesus forgive us and sits right now on the right hand of God the Father praying for us? This is process of healing, the more you pray for them, the more you the power of un forgiveness releases you. The earnest (heartfelt, continued) prayer of a righteous man makes tremendous power available [dynamic in its working]”. If un forgiveness has stolen your power, how else can you pray with power? Joseph was put to a test where he needed to forgive his bothers. It was not easy if you read Genesis but he did, the power of forgiveness was in is hand. He took the offense and looked at it differently saying, “though you meant it for evil, God turned something good out of it” (paraphrased). Romans 8:28, “And we know that ALL (not some) things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are the called according to His purpose”. In the light of His word, I can get illuminations in understanding that every thing that happens in my life, good or bad works for my good because I love Him. If I’m offended, it works for my good only if I look and deal with it the way the Lord would have me. It can push me forward or backwards depending on my attitude. If I forgive, how easy my simple prayer to God can be powerful and avail much. The message today is simple, the power of forgiveness in in your hands, let it lock or release you according to the way you use it. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 18:41-45, “Then it came to pass the seventh time, that he said, “There is a cloud, as small as a man’s hand, rising out of the sea!” So he said, “Go up, say to Ahab, ‘Prepare your chariot, and go down before the rain stops you.’”

God answers prayers, I am a firm believer of that, He amazes me as to how He does answer prayers. If you are going to expect a miracle from God, don’t be surprised if He does it in a way you never imagined. He is a God of surprises therefore you have to know HIS WAYS to know when He is moving. The bible says in Psalm 103:7, “He made known His ways to Moses, His acts to the children of Israel”. Many only rejoice in the acts of God and that is okay but knowing His acts limits you to understanding how He does things. Moses was not frustrated when God was not acting, He knew God’s ways to know how and when God would move. When you know God’s ways, even if He does not act, you can see why He hasn’t acted and you can see what He doing in your life as he prepares you for the miracle. The Potter can only make a jar because He has something to put in it. How will a broken leaking jar hold anything poured into it? If your jar is leaking, if He was to pour that miracle in you, be sure it will leak out. That was the problem with the Israelites, they were leaking vessels always needing an act of God for them to know God was with them and when it leaked out, they cried some more. Are we not like that at times praying for miracles when our jars are leaking?. I would rather know His ways than His acts.

Elijah has just prayed by calling on heaven and instantly God answered him by fire in vs. 38. What an instant miracle, God answering by fire what He had prayed. I have had those moments when I prayed and instantly God answered me by fire (granted my request). Then moving to vs. 41, Elijah operates by faith, he tells king Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain”. Was there a great sound of rain? You can pave away for move by prayer.

Blessings
Evans

There was a woman who had been diagnosed with a terminal illness and had been given three months to live. So as she was getting her things “in order,” she contacted her pastor and had him come to her house to discuss certain aspects of her final wishes. She told him which songs she wanted sung at the service, what scriptures she would like read, and what outfit she wanted to be buried in. The woman also requested to be buried with her favorite Bible. 

Everything was in order and the pastor was preparing to leave when the woman suddenly remembered something very important to her. 

“There’s one more thing,” she said excitedly. 

“What’s that?” came the pastor’s reply. 

“This is very important,” the woman continued. “I want to be buried with a fork in my right hand.” The pastor stood looking at the woman, not knowing quite what to say. “That surprises you, doesn’t it?” the woman asked. 

“Well, to be honest, I’m puzzled by the request,” said the pastor. 

The woman explained. “In all my years of attending church socials and potluck dinners, I always remember that when the dishes of the main course were being cleared, someone would inevitably lean over and say, ‘Keep your fork.’ It was my favorite part because I knew that something better was coming…like velvety chocolate cake or deep-dish apple pie. Something wonderful, and with substance!” 

So, I just want people to see me there in that casket with a fork in my hand and I want them to wonder “What’s with the fork?” Then I want you to tell them: “Keep your fork…the best is yet to come”. 

The pastor’s eyes welled up with tears of joy as he hugged the woman good-bye. He knew this would be one of the last times he would see her before her death. But he also knew that the woman had a better grasp of heaven than he did. She KNEW that something better was coming. 

At the funeral people were walking by the woman’s casket and they saw the pretty dress she was wearing, her favorite Bible and the fork placed in her right hand. Over and over, the pastor heard the question “What’s with the fork?” And over and over he smiled. 

During his message, the pastor told the people of the conversation he had with the woman shortly before she died. He also told them about the fork and about what it symbolized to her. The pastor told the people how he could not stop thinking about the fork and told them that they probably would not be able to stop thinking about it either. He was right. 

So the next time you reach down for your fork, let it remind you oh so gently, that the best is yet to come.

The upstate NY man was rich in almost every way. His estate was worth millions. He owned houses, land, antiques and cattle. But though on the outside he had it all, he was very unhappy on the inside. His wife was growing old, and the couple was childless. He had always wanted a little boy to carry on the family legacy.

Miraculously, his wife became pregnant in her later years, and she gave birth to a little boy. The boy was severely handicapped, but the man loved him with his whole heart. When the boy was five, his mom died. The dad drew closer to his special son. At age 13, the boys’ birth defects cost him his life and the father died soon after from a broken heart.

The estate was auctioned before hundreds of bidders. The first item offered was a painting of the boy. No one bid. They waited like vultures for the riches. Finally, the poor housemaid, who helped raise the boy, offered $5 for the picture and easily took the bid. To every-one’s shock, the auctioneer ripped a hand written will from the back of the picture.

This is what it said: “To the person who thinks enough of my son to buy this painting, to this person I give my entire estate.”

The auction was over. The greedy crowd walked away in shock and dismay.

How many of us have sought after what we thought were true riches only to find out later that our Father was prepared to give us His entire estate if we had only sought after His Son Jesus alone?

The surgeon sat beside the boy’s bed, the boy’s parents sat across from him. “Tomorrow morning,” the surgeon began, “I’ll open up your heart.”

“You’ll find Jesus there,” the boy interrupted.

The surgeon looked up, annoyed. “I’ll cut your heart open,” he continued, “to see how much damage has been done.”

“But when you open up my heart, you’ll find Jesus in there.”

The surgeon looked to the parents, who sat quietly. “When I see how much damage has been done, I’ll sew your heart and chest back up and I’ll plan what to do next.”

“But you’ll find Jesus in my heart. The Bible says He lives there. You’ll find Him in my heart.”

The surgeon had had enough. “I’ll tell you what I’ll find in your heart. I’ll find damaged muscle, low blood supply, and weakened vessels. And I’ll find out if I can make you well.”

“You’ll find Jesus there too. He lives there.”

The surgeon left annoyed. He sat in his office, recording his notes from the surgery. “…damaged aorta, damaged pulmonary vein, widespread muscle degeneration. No hope for transplant, no hope for cure. Therapy: painkillers and bed rest. Prognosis,” here he paused, “death within one year.”

He stopped the recorder, but there was more to be said. “Why?” he asked aloud. “Why did You do this? You’ve put him here, You’ve put him in this pain, and You’ve cursed him to an early death. Why? ”

The Lord answered and said, “The boy, My lamb, was not meant for your flock for long, for he is a part of My flock, and will forever be. Here, in My flock, he will feel no pain, and will be comforted as you cannot imagine. His parents will one day join him here, and they will know peace, and My flock will continue to grow.”

The surgeon’s tears were hot, but his anger was hotter. “You created that boy, and You created that heart. He’ll be dead in months. Why?”

The Lord answered, “The boy, My lamb, shall return to My flock, for he has done his duty. I did not put My lamb with your flock to lose him, but to retrieve another lost lamb.”

The surgeon wept & sat beside the boy’s bed.

The boy awoke and whispered, “Did you cut open my heart?”

“Yes,” said the surgeon.

“What did you find?” asked the boy.

“I found Jesus there,” said the surgeon.

Sheriff Marr got a disturbing call one Saturday afternoon a few months ago. His 6-year-old grandson Mikey had been hit by a car while fishing with his dad. The father and son were near a bridge when a woman lost control of her car, slid off the bridge and hit Mikey. 

Sheriff Marr had seen the results of accidents like his and feared the worst. When he got to the Hospital, he rushed through the emergency room to find Mikey conscious and in fairly good spirits Mikey, “what happened?” Sheriff Marr asked. 

Mikey replied, “Well, Papaw, I was fishin’ with Dad, and some lady runned me over, I flew into a mud puddle, and broke my fishin’ pole and I didn’t get to catch no fish!” 

As it turned out, the impact propelled Mikey about 500 feet, over a few trees and an embankment and in the middle of a mud puddle. His injuries were minor. 

Since all the boy could talk about was that his fishing pole was broken, the Sheriff went out to Mart and bought him a new one while he was in surgery so he could have it when he came out. 

The next day the Sheriff sat with Mikey to keep him company in the hospital. Mikey was enjoying his new fishing pole and talked about when he could go fishing again as he cast into the trash can. 

When they were alone, Mikey, just a matter-of-fact, said, “Papaw, did you know God is real?” 

“Well,” the Sheriff replied, a little startled. “Yes, God is real to all who believe in him and love him in their hearts.” 

“No,” said Mikey. “I mean God is REALLY real.” 

“What do you mean?” asked the Sheriff. 

“I know he’s real ’cause I saw him.” said Mikey, still casting into the trash can. 

“You did?” said the Sheriff. 

“Yep,” said Mikey. “When that lady runned me over and broke my fishing pole, God caught me in his arms and laid me down in the mud puddle.”

It amazes how God does not do things according to the way we think. He always takes a different turn and just when you think you have figured Him out, he does something that blows your mind and you are back to seeking to know more. Abel, Jacob, and the prodigal son have one thing in common, they are second born and no one ever expected them to be blessed Why is this important? simple, God is in the business of raising the second (the unexpected).

The first tends to be stubborn and unwilling to humble himself, therefore God always bypasses the first to establish the second. God bypassed Adam the first man created to send Jesus the second Adam. What Adam messed up, Jesus came to fix it.

For God to build the second, the layer of the first has to come out that the tender heart of the second may be established. While the first may desire to do things his own way, the second is seeking ways to do the will of the Father. In the world we were like the first stubborn born and God had to bypass all that to bring out the inner child inside of us that accepts Him by faith. Mark 10:15, “Assuredly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it.” It’s not the sophisticated, all knowing and looking able that He raises, He raises the weak, the one who feels he is unable but yet available.

The word “establish” means to bring about, to place or settle. What’s God word saying to us “He takes away the first that He may establish the second”. Are you glad that He has called you in spite of your weaknesses, failures, insecurities to establish you simply because you were willing to do His will? He bypassed everything you new about yourself to build the inner child kind of faith you never knew you had. What you placed second in your life is what He has come to establish. What you never thought He could use is what He is establishing. Our prayer today, Lord establish in our lives what we placed second, insignificant and unexpected. Good morning,Ezekiel 37:1-14, “… And He said unto me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…”

I am a walking miracle how about you?. Many times when you’ve survived a tough situation, you get a hint that if it were not for someone who came to your rescue, you would still be in it if not dead. Knowing all about where you’ve come from and how you managed to get this far all you can say is, “if it were not for the mercies of God I would have been consumed”. You cannot live long with yourself before you realize that wherever place you plan on making it to, God will be your key help. We are therefore motivated by realty that without Him, we can do nothing.

To my amazement I hear people talking about how they worked their way to the top, how they made things work out, how they had wisdom and knowledge for this and that etc may I remind that John 15:5, says “… for without Me you can do nothing…”, When I know that my daily existence depends on God, I have to continually involve Him in my daily activities and constantly thank Him for what He has done and doing in my life for my confidence is not in me but in Him. Next time you feel like you can do it yourself, try walking on water.

Vs. 1, “The hand of the Lord came upon me and brought me out in the Spirit of the Lord, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones” We are looking at a man being led by the Spirit of the living God. Instead of being led to comfortable place, a place of rest, he is brought to a valley full of very dry bones. Why would a loving God bring someone to the lowest pits of hell to see things like dry bones? The bible says that Jesus full of the Holy Ghost was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil. Jesus again is led of the Spirit to a forbidden place. There must be a good reason why God at times brings us to the valley of very dry bones as there is something that we need to learn about being there. At times when we have reached to the top, we tend to forget that there are people who are still in the valley that need rescue and because we have nothing to remind us of that, we have to be brought back to this place that we may be used to make a difference. Where we work at times can be a valley of dry bones but because we are used to sailing in the Spirit, we tend to forget to see what is beneath us and so we have to be reminded. For any one to be effective in the ministry, job, family or be successful in anything, at one point in your life you will be brought to a valley. The valley is not to kill or place you back to where you came from, it’s to prepare each and every one of us for a greater move of God in our lives.

It’s in the valley that we get humbled, in the valley that’s where our strength is energized, that’s where we see the Lord in action, that’s where our faith is tested to see whether we are living by faith or by feeling, that’s where we see how God can use us. As long as you are on the safe ground where nothing much is going on, you will never know how much God can use you as there is no business, we have to move to where the customers are to see what God has placed in our lives. The good thing about being back in the valley is that He is with us Psalm 23:4, “Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me; Your rod and Your stuff, they comfort me”.

I have just introduced a topic that we will look at in the next few days. My desire is that we would all grow in the Spiritual matters and move from feeding on milk to eating strong meat as that’s a sign of growth. I desire to see Christians begin to take ownership and utilize and maximize their different gifts, put them into use and bless us with them. The reason why I believe in equipping is that when I’m not there, or if need be, someone else can still grab the ball and run with it. Someone gave me a chance one time and by God’s grace I am what I am because of that, you too have chance to begin from somewhere if you haven’t.

Have a blessed day Ev

Ezekiel 37:1-14, “… And He said unto me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…”

Vs. 9, “Then He said unto me, prophesy unto the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, thus says the Lord God; come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe upon these slain, that they may live”. Nothing will ever be complete until God breathes on it. The breathe of God is His Spirit breathed into the mortal body that it might live. It’s through having the breath that you become aware of who you are, this is how you can tell the difference between right and wrong, this is where you realize where you are and where you need to move to. Let’s not just rejoice that we have been put back together and covered but let it even be a greater joy that His Spirit gives us life and through Him. A valley that was once dead is a live again because God restored life.

Just like He spoke to Ezekiel, He is speaking to us in the valley. Just like He caused Ezekiel to speak life into a situation that was impossible with man, He is causing us to speak life in our tough situations. Just like life came back in the valley of dry bones, life is coming back to you, why? Because God is the business of restoration. He has revealed that He wants to restore us, are we ready for it? If so the here is His word for you and me. Joel 2:25&26, “25 “ So I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The crawling locust, The consuming locust, And the chewing locust,

[] My great army which I sent among you. 26 You shall eat in plenty and be satisfied, And praise the name of the LORD your God, Who has dealt wondrously with you; And My people shall never be put to shame. It was a secret before so it belonged to Him, now that He has revealed His plan, it’s not a secret anymore therefore blessing is being restored to us. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Don’t Choke on the Blessing – Part 1, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 13: 1 – 4 “So Abram went up from Egypt to the Negev, with his wife and everything he had, and Lot went with him. Abram had become very wealthy in livestock and in silver and gold.   From the Negev he went from place to place until he came to Bethel, to the place between Bethel and Ai where his tent had been earlier and where he had first built an altar. There Abram called on the name of the LORD.”

Are you content with what God has given you?  Solomon wrote, “Death and Destruction are never satisfied, and neither are the eyes of man” (Prov. 27:20).  There is something about the majority of us that always wants more then God has given us.   Let me ask you another question.  When do you seek God most?  Is it when things are going smooth or when things are not going so well?  Many seek God when they are not content with the way things are going in their lives. Are we not to seek God at all times, even during times of contentment?

The great prophet Abram (Abraham) is called by God to take all of his things, and his family and to journey to a place that God would show him.  Abraham obeys God, leaves all that is familiar to him, and starts on his journey to “God knows where.”  When he arrives at a place between Bethel and Ai he builds and altar and calls upon the name of the Lord.   Although Abram was rich in cattle, gold and silver, he didn’t choke on the blessing God gave him. Why not?

1.  Abram was content.  Abram didn’t try to fight God’s call, but rather took up his household and lived a nomadic lifestyle in his obedience to God.  He didn’t go on a journey for more of what he “wanted,” but rather more of what God wanted for him.  Paul wrote that “godliness with contentment is great gain” (1 Tim 6:6).  Are you one that is content, or always wanting for more of what God is not calling you to? Are you content with what God has given you, in your job, your home, your friends, your family, your appearance, or do you yearn for more.

2.  Abram built an altar.    What comes to mind when you hear the word altar.  Perhaps words like sacrifice, sacred, special, offering, incense, prayer, are some of those words.  An altar was a place designed for worship.  Pagans set up their altars to worship their false gods many times made of wood, stone.  God designed humanity to be worshipers, the only question remains is who or what will one seek to worship.  Whatever the case, man will build an altar of worship either with his hands or his mind.  Where is your altar, where is the place that you seek God? No one built the altar for Abram, he built it and so should you establish a place whereby you seek God daily.  The New Testament refers to the prayer closet as the place to seek Him.  When two people are going to meet they establish a meeting place.  Where is your established meeting place with God?  If you don’t have a place, establish one today, as a sacred meeting place between you and God.

3.  Abram called upon God.  Abram didn’t allow his wealth to hinder his worship.  It’s not enough to build an altar; one must meet with God there.  Do you meet with God daily at the altar, in the prayer closet?  Prayer is a conversation between two people that love each other -you and God.  Do you daily meet with God in prayer and read His word, because He is the Word (John 1)?  Some never bother to “pick up the phone” to even call God, or if they do, it is a one-sided conversation.  What has God been saying to you lately?  If you’re drawing a blank, then perhaps you have not been calling upon His name and listening to his response as Abram did.  If so are you content with that?  If God has blessed you don’t choke on the blessing.  Be content, build an altar, and call upon God there.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Ever heard of being on an all time high:
Say you just started you day and they told you that you have been promoted / or that there is a marvellous pay hike / added incentives / a new exciting role / followed by an old friend who wasn’t in good terms with you, suddenly comes back reconciling / and then sometime in the week your mom bakes your favourite fruit cake / and you love it every bit  / and then you have an awesome time of worship in Church on Saturday evening / study a lot of WORD with friends / get mutually encouraged / and then on your way back home from Church you spot a very needy person / you not only help him out with money but also share the Life saving Gospel of Jesus Christ / you go back home to find your favourite dinner served on the table / post dinner you spend some quality time in prayer and intercession / you then begin to intercede for your longtime friends and colleagues, totally led by the Spirit/ and much later hit the bed .
Now what would you call such days – This is the day the Lord has made, we will rejoice and be glad in Him!
I’ll do anything for a day like that. Where there is no worry, no tension, no fear but only JOY and PEACE!
But our stories aren’t quite the same, are they? Not all our days are, forget being similar, even close to the above given description…!
We are Dedicated Christians, who do everything as though unto the Lord, for sure!
We surely realize that the Good Lord put us in our respective work places, for a purpose.
I am sure all of us know that many of our dear colleagues/friends aren’t saved.
I am sure we are doing our bit in spreading the LIGHT, and sharing the LIFE giving gospel, at every opportunity.
I am sure we are a part of a Prayer cell or a bible study.
I am sure we get lots of devotions, and encouraging Christian messages on mail.
And I am quite sure, we are setting a great example for many others, as faithful Christians.
Yet If we were to describe our life at work, the first few quick words that come to our mind are “hectic / monotonous / boring …”
If YOU think, my idea was to dispute this, no its NOT. That is not my intention. I actually am in complete agreement. The fact is, if someone were to ask me the same question, I’d probably get the same first thought. I think, it is but quite natural. It is not easy, for the pressure is such!
Lets check what Paul writes In one of his letters, Paul mentions that he is pressing on towards the goal…
13… But one thing I do: Forgetting what is behind and straining toward what is ahead, 14 I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
Press on:- These words can do magic in your life … Let us understand them better,
-To Press on requires additional effort.
-You press on when the tide is against you..
-The more determined you are to reach the goal, the more you press on- Direct proportionality.
-You can also, just sit back, and let the current carry you! But you wouldn’t be sure where you are headed!

content.rendered: Good morning, Ezekiel 37:1-14, “… And He said unto me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…” Vs. 4-6, “Again He said unto me, prophesy upon these bone, and say unto them, o ye dry bones hear the word of the Lord, thus saith the Lord God unto these bones; behold I will cause breath to enter into you and ye shall live, and I will lay sinews upon you and will bring up flesh upon you and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live and ye shall know that I am the Lord”. When we have trusted the Lord and have given Him everything, there maybe times where the Lord will prompt us to prophesy things over our situations. We need to understand that prophesy is calling things that are not into existence to at a period of time according to the prophesy, prophesy to me is also a sign of abundance. Life and death is the power of the tongue the bible tells us, so prophesy life over what you have to deal with. It’s not upon you to see the result, it’s upon you to be faithful to the Master’s word after all if it doesn’t work, blame Him but wait a minute, I heard Him say that no word that proceeds from His mouth shall return to Him void but it shall accomplish that which it is sent for and I also heard Him say that He is not a man that He should lie neither is He the son of man that He should repent, if He said it, He will do it. We may not know when but we know for sure that it will come to pass. Vs. 7, “So I prophesied as I was commanded:”. It’s good to know that it’s not my words but God’s words in action as I begin to prophesy. I begin to see things from His point of view, I haven’t reached but I can feel like I am already there. I might still be in the midst of that tough situation, but I can smell my victory at a distance, all I got do is to embrace it at a distance. He prophesied and there was a great noise and shaking and the bones began to rattle and come together, it was time for restoration It’s time to bring back what has been scattered in different places, if you have been disoriented by things you had to deal with, it’s time to put you back together. This is significant as everyone has to be restored with the uniquely gifts the Lord had designed for everyone. Not everyone is a like and if we all looked the same, sounded the same and did things the same, what a boring world this would be. The bones coming together was the ground work and just like building a house, there is always the frame structure before the house can be complete. Though in the world we were skeletons that might have looked alike in sin, when He covered us, He gave us unique identity. I believe God does deal with us individually first before collectively. He takes knowledge of you. David says in Psalm 144:3, “LORD, what is man, that You take knowledge of him? Or the son of man, that You are mindful of him? To continue. content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ezekiel 37:1-14, “… And He said unto me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…”

Vs. 2, Then He caused me to pass by them all around, and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and indeed they were very dry. If there was a way to avoid going to the valley everyone would, Jesus would have loved for the cup of suffering to pass Him, we do desire the same everyday. I don’t like going through tough situations inflicting in my body and so by all means, if I can avoid it, I will try to. Jesus gives us a clear picture of what He desires and that is the will of God and therefore He says, “Not my will but your will be done”. If I have trusted you to get me this far, I’m going to have to trust you to get me through this tough situation for you have a good reason for allowing me to go through it because your word says in. Psalm 119:71, “It is good for me to have been afflicted, that I may learn thy statutes”, and that Psalm 34:19, “Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord delivers him out of them all”. Jesus becomes our point of reference where we say that if He went through it and became victorious, we too can.

Ezekiel is being shown around and everything that He looks at is nothing but dry bones, the bible does stress how very dry they were. The result of these bones may have occurred by war in this valley many years ago as the bible says that they were so dry and scattered in different places. There was no life in this valley, the valley was so quiet that all it could do was bring back memories of emptiness, confusion, frustrations, pain and suffering. A life that was once precious and worth living for had been reduced to nothing but bones.

If you are like me, you would throw away bones as they are of no use to me. If I had chicken drum stick, all I need is the meat covering the bone. Once I’m done with the meat, I trash the bone. I would expect the same with God only to discover He has something in store for the bones that no one else wants. There is power that flows through the bones when God uses them. Elisha was long dead, he had been reduced to bones, in the process of burying a man who had just died, the pallbearers stumbled and dropped the man’s body on Elisha’s bones and he came back to life. Samson used a jawbone of a donkey to kill about 800 people. God can use the bones to accomplish His work. Look around you and you will see dry bones, people who have lost hope, confidence, sick, frustrated, confused, depressed, no joy, no peace etc. Being brought back to the valley is to remind me of who I used to be and how someone else is still in that valley that I came from.

What’s my point? God can use anything to accomplish His work, the thing you wanted to trash because you never thought He could use, that is what He will use, for His ways are not our ways and His thoughts are not our thoughts, …, Isaiah 55:8. That person who nobody ever thought could be saved or delivered, He will bring them up. Just because we don’t see anything good come out of them does not change God’s plan for their lives. We have been brought to the valley to witness what He can do with what we gave up on. Who ever thought that Jesus’ death would change the entire world? the devil made the biggest mistake when He crucified Jesus on the cross. Jesus had been healing the sick, raising the dead, turning water into wine and teaching, so the devil thought, “if I can kill Him, He will do none of these anymore”. The devil was foolish  not to understand that the life of the flesh is in the blood and so if the body stops, the blood will continue to do the work. No one had known the power of the blood for it was just a little thing that many had overlooked. Nailing Him on the cross did not mark His end for He kept on preaching while on the cross, one of the thieves got saved on the cross and when He died, all hell broke loose for He stormed into the devils kingdom. Read it for yourself and you will see, just like Samson, Jesus destroyed more enemies in His death than He did in His life. Never under estimate what God can do with that is overlooked. To continue. Look around you and you will see dry bones, people who have lost hope, confidence, sick, frustrated, confused, depressed, no joy, no peace etc. Being brought back to the valley is to remind me of who I used to be and how someone else is still in that valley that I came from.

What’s my point? God can use anything to accomplish His work, the thing you wanted to trash because you never thought He could use, that is what He will use, for His ways are not our ways and His thoughts are not our thoughts, …, Isaiah 55:8. That person who nobody ever thought could be saved or delivered, He will bring them up. Just because we don’t see anything good come out of them does not change God’s plan for their lives. We have been brought to the valley to witness what He can do with what we gave up on. Read it for yourself and you will see, just like Samson, Jesus destroyed more enemies in His death than He did in His life. Never under estimate what God can do with that is overlooked. To continue. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Ezekiel 37:1-14, “… And He said unto me, “Son of man, can these bones live?…”

I am a walking miracle how about you?. Many times when you’ve survived a tough situation, you get a hint that if it were not for someone who came to your rescue, you would still be in it if not dead. Knowing all about where you’ve come from and how you managed to get this far all you can say is, “if it were not for the mercies of God I would have been consumed”. You cannot live long with yourself before you realize that wherever place you plan on making it to, God will be your key help. We are therefore motivated by realty that without Him, we can do nothing.

To my amazement I hear people talking about how they worked their way to the top, how they made things work out, how they had wisdom and knowledge for this and that etc may I remind  that John 15:5, says “… for without Me you can do nothing…”, When I know that my daily existence depends on God, I have to continually involve Him in my daily activities and constantly thank Him for what He has done and doing in my life for my confidence is not in me but in Him. Next time you feel like you can do it yourself, try walking on water.

Vs. 1, “The hand of the Lord came upon me and brought me out in the Spirit of the Lord, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones” We are looking at a man being led by the Spirit of the living God. Instead of being led to comfortable place, a place of rest, he is brought to a valley full of very dry bones. Why would a loving God bring someone to the lowest pits of hell to see things like dry bones? The bible says that Jesus full of the Holy Ghost was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil. Jesus again is led of the Spirit to a forbidden place. There must be a good reason why God at times brings us to the valley of very dry bones as there is something that we need to learn about being there. At times when we have reached to the top, we tend to forget that there are people who are still in the valley that need rescue and because we have nothing to remind us of that, we have to be brought back to this place that we may be used to make a difference. Where we work at times can be a valley of dry bones but because we are used to sailing in the Spirit, we tend to forget to see what is beneath us and so we have to be reminded. For any one to be effective in the ministry, job, family or be successful in anything, at one point in your life you will be brought to a valley. The valley is not to kill or place you back to where you came from, it’s to prepare each and every one of us for a greater move of God in our lives.

It’s in the valley that we get humbled, in the valley that’s where our strength is energized, that’s where we see the Lord in action, that’s where our faith is tested to see whether we are living by faith or by feeling, that’s where we see how God can use us. As long as you are on the safe ground where nothing much is going on, you will never know how much God can use you as there is no business, we have to move to where the customers are to see what God has placed in our lives. The good thing about being back in the valley is that He is with us Psalm 23:4, “Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil; for You are with me; Your rod and Your stuff, they comfort me”.

I have just introduced a topic that we will look at in the next few days. My desire is that we would all grow in the Spiritual matters and move from feeding on milk to eating strong meat as that’s a sign of growth. I desire to see Christians begin to take ownership and utilize and maximize their different gifts, put them into use and bless us with them. The reason why I believe in equipping is that when I’m not there, or if need be, someone else can still grab the ball and run with it. Someone gave me a chance one time and by God’s grace I am what I am because of that, you too have chance to begin from somewhere if you haven’t. Have a blessed day Ev

Good morning,

Jeremiah 1:9, Then the LORD reached out his hand and touched my mouth and said to me, “Now, I have put my words in your mouth. 10 See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant, (NIV)

Happy new year , it’s good to be back in the new year. Every year we trust God to do something spectacular and we are in the new year expecting the same. Everyone has things they are expecting in the new year and we are placing everything in the hands of the Lord to see us through as we move to greater dimensions. I don’t know about you but I am expecting God to teach me to thrive.

When God called Jeremiah, He had something great stored for him. He may have not known about it but God did. God designed him for a job He had set aside till the right time. The first encouragement God gives him Jeremiah 1:5, “ Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; Before you were born I sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet to the nations.” Do you realize that God did not have an idea of what to do with your life after He made you, He made you because He had an idea of what to do with your life. Four things for our process, 1. God knew us, then 2. He formed us, then 3. He sanctified us, then 4. He ordained us. Mark the order because the order is important. In every step you see God, the only way Jeremiah would thrive. God knows us better than we know ourselves and what we feel we are not able to do because of what we think of ourselves does not change His plan for our destiny. You may say like Jeremiah  that you cannot speak because you are a child (weak, immature) but hear what the Lord is saying in verse 7, “do not say, “I’m only a child”(NIV), in other words, don’t speak about what you think you know of yourself, speak of what I have told you about yourself. If we are going to thrive in 2006, we have to set aside what we think and feel about ourselves to operate on what God has told us about us in His WORD. If we can grasp this concept, then we are ready for the next move of God. Vs 9 Then the LORD reached out His hand and touched my mouth and said to me, “Now, I have put my words in your mouth. God took him from what he thought of himself to how He knew, formed, sanctified and ordained him to be, then empowered him by placing His words in Him through touching his mouth. The next move, 10 See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant, (NIV). Who can be appointed if they have nothing in them to accompany that appointment, God has empowered us through His word then appointed us for a task that requires that empowerment. To thrive we will have to uproot, tear, destroy and overthrow everything that try’s to set itself high against the knowledge that God has placed in us about us. Anything that tries to go above what God has told us about us has to go for they are hindrance to our building and planting. He has give us the power to uproot, tear, destroy, overthrow, build and plant. We can thrive in this year because He is teaching us how to.

Let this year be a year that we all thrive to greater levels as we say, “Lord hold us close and teach us so that we can thrive”. We want to make steady progress, we want to prosper, we want to flourish, we want to grow stronger because all these are what thriving means. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: A Picture Worth Living, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

We wish you a happy new year and God’s blessings as in the coming year. Ev

“This is what the LORD Almighty says: “Once again men and women of ripe old age will sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each with cane in hand because of his age. The city streets will be filled with boys and girls playing there.” This is what the LORD Almighty says: “It may seem marvelous to the remnant of this people at that time, but will it seem marvelous to me?” declares the LORD Almighty.”          Zechariah 8:4-5

When reading this verse what comes to mind?  Perhaps for many may reminisce about your own childhood.  As a child, I remember a neighbor sitting out on his deck often with his wife.  I also recall playing on one particular dead end street where I formed many childhood friendships.  It was great because there were only two houses on the street so traffic was not an issue.  The sight of the aged sitting outside and children playing paints a vivid picture of tranquility and safety.  Many seniors today are placed in nursing homes, and many children are not playing in the streets but are, as we say in New York City, “running the streets.”    When will this picture become a reality?  In the hit movie, The Lord of the Rings, the King returned to take his throne, and peace reigned in the land. When our King Jesus returns the picture painted by Zechariah will be an authentic one.  When Christ returns, the prophet tells us.

Wisdom is visible.  The aged will sit in the streets, each with cane in hand.  Proverbs 16:31 tells us, “Gray hair is a crown of splendor; it is attained by a righteous life.”  Many today are too busy to listen to the wisdom of the aged righteous.  However at Christ’s return, I believe, there will be seniors sharing their wisdom to ears ready to listen.  When the aged speak do you listen to their wisdom?

2.    Fun is visible.  Children were depicted playing in the streets.  Many of the streets nowadays are not as safe to play in.  Kids are “running the streets,” getting into trouble, instead of playing.  As children many of us laugh, play, dream, and have fun, but as adults we seem to let those things fade into the background, and fall by the wayside by the voice of “responsibility” and work, to which many follow its tune.  Work and responsibilities never seem to end, but its time to laugh again, dream again, and yes even to play again.  The old saying goes, “All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.”  Keep the fun flowing in your life.  When Christ returns kids will once again be able to play again and perhaps we will all be able to “be a kid again” ourselves.

3.    Enjoyment is visible.  With the aged sitting in the streets and children playing in the streets, life has peace, prosperity, and security.  The prophet Isaiah shares similarly in 65:20 “Never again will there be in it an infant who lives but a few days, or an old man who does not live out his years…”  Praise the Lord, for this time that we have to look forward to of unhindered enjoyment with our Savior, and fellow believers.  However there are plenty of things in our lives to enjoy now as we wait.

During this Christmas season my nephew Antonio and I got to spend a few quality days together.  We played together, laughed together, and even wrestled around in some Star Wars light saber battles.  My five year old nephew “Tones” as we call him taught me a lot of things that I forget at times, and inspired this message.  As we weight for our Savior, let us appropriate wisdom, fun, and enjoyment into our Christian lives, because in His presence is fullness of JOY!

content.rendered:
Good morning,

For those who have requested for addresses to be added to the list or taken out, please be patient with me till next week when I get some breathing space after year end rush. Ev
Then they said to him, ” Tell us, now! On whose account {has} this calamity {struck} us? What is your occupation? And where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?” 9 He said to them, “I am a Hebrew, and I fear the LORD God of heaven who made the sea and the dry land.” 10 Then the men became extremely frightened and they said to him, “How could you do this?” For the men knew that he was fleeing from the presence of the LORD, because he had told them.  11 So they said to him, “What should we do to you that the sea may become calm for us?”–for the sea was becoming increasingly stormy. 12 He said to them, “Pick me up and throw me into the sea. Then the sea will become calm for you, for I know that on account of me this great storm {has come} upon you.
Have you ever been on your way someplace and someone was trying to speak with you and time was of the essence at that moment?  If so then you were having a conversation on the run.  However what happens when you have a conversation and you are on the run from God?  The story of the running prophet is none other then Jonah, called be God to go to Nineveh, but running to Tarshish which was in the opposite direction.  Jonah had a conversation with pagans as to the nature of the storm which the pagans felt were going to take their lives.  While he was on the run from God from which we can learn what to do if we ever find ourselves having conversations of the run from the Lord.
Disobedience is seen by others.  During the times that we are in disobedience to God, we are trying to hide from God, but others see the symptoms of our disease of sin.  When everyone was trying to deal with the problem of the storm Jonah was sleeping instead of trying to help.  Did he really think he could hide from hid Creator who knows and sees all?

2.    Disobedience becomes your witness?  Jonah was staying below the ship instead of shinning above it.  God has called us to shine his light to the world.  During disobedience that light does not shine to the brightness that it was meant to.  Like Jonah we too are called, yes you, everyone of you, to preach repentance to the unsaved.  However the motivation to preach repentance will not be present in your life if you are not repenting yourself, and need to, and if you are not engaging in reaching the lost as Jonah had for a time.  The only two answers to disobedience are ultimately death or repentance.  Choose!

3.    Disobedience is questioned by others.  The pagan sailors asked Jonah a flurry of questions: Tell us, now! On whose account {has} this calamity {struck} us? What is your occupation? And where do you come from? What is your country? From what people are you?  It was Jonah’s disobedience that promoted these questions.  Now these pagans were religious people as each called upon their own God, but eventually, I believe that, Jonah was seen as a hypocrite.   “Hypocrites may show up at a church building every Sunday, but there are no hypocrites in the Church (Christ’s body). Hypocrite comes from the Greek word for “actor,” or pretender. Hypocrisy is “the practice of professing beliefs, feelings, or virtues that one does not hold.” The Church is made up of true believers; hypocrites are “pretenders” who sit among God’s people.

4.    Disobedience affects others.  Jonah’s disobedience affected those on the ship.  Although it may not kill others, your disobedience to God hurts other people, many of those people are ones that you love, perhaps family members, friends.  The unsaved (as in Jonah’s case) are also hurt because you are not walking in your role as a witness, therefore they remain lost.  Disobedience I seen by others, becomes your witness, is questioned by others, and affects others.  Repent today, or tell someone else their need to repent, because disobedience is not worth it.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: You are a victor not a victim of defeat

content.rendered:
Good morning,

It is not what you know but who you know and whose you are that matters most when it comes to overcoming the world.

Today, I want to share with you a verse from the Bible that clearly and simply define who you are, and tell you whose you are and finally, affirms that you are already an over comer and further assures you victory over the devil and every evil forces, powers, authorities etc. that operate in this ‘wild wide world’ of ours. Here it is,

“You are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.” (1 John 4:4)

I can’t overemphasize the importance and need for every believing and practicing Christian to understand, believe and live by this scripture. It tells you, first whose you are, “You are of God.” That means that you are not your own; you are owned and therefore cannot be on your own, unless you choose to.

Second, it tells you who you are, “a little child.” Right. A little child is dependant on its parents for care, protection and provision of everything it needs. That is the same way God works. He is our father; we are his little children. He provides all that we have need of to live abundant and victorious life. It is foolish to try to behave and live like a grown up that thinks that he is independent and can make it on his own. Such an attitude is arrogant, ungodly and self-defeating. No one can go far with that negative attitude. A little child is a “dependant not an independent” being.

Third, your victory affirmed. You have already overcome everything that might be opposed to you or are fighting you. It does not say, “You may or will overcome” them; it says that you have already. Whoever is needed and whatever is necessary for overcoming is already residing and deposited inside of you, and that is what is referred to in this verse as, “greater.”
Take time to meditate and glean slowly and carefully on the verse and allow the Holy Spirit to help you grasp what He is communicating. Read it again and again. Memorize it and quote it as often as you can. Draw it out like a weapon and use it against Satan whenever he attacks or intimidates you. You are a victor not a victim of defeat. God bless you.

Boaz Olang

Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back. But he was not strong enough, and they lost their place in heaven. The great dragon was hurled down–that ancient serpent called the devil, or Satan, who leads the whole world astray. He was hurled to the earth, and his angels with him. (Rev 12:1 – 8)

When one thinks about the Christmas story and the birth of Christ, most go to Luke 1 and Matthew 2 to read about the account. Rarely would one turn to Revelation 12 to read the Christmas story, but this gives us the behind the look at what was taking place in the spiritual realm at the time of Christ’s birth.  As Philip Yancy says, “I have never seen this version of the Christmas story on a Christmas card.  Yet is it the truer story, the rest of the picture of what was going on that fateful night.  Yancy calls the birth of Christ the Great Invasion, “a daring paid by the ruler of the forces of good into the universe’s seat of evil.”  Spiritually speaking, this is no “Silent Night”, It is D-Day!  It’s almost beyond my comprehension altogether, yet it is part of the foundation of my faith.  We live in parallel worlds or realms.  One world is that which we can see of buildings, politicians, moneys, computers, etc…, while the other is a world which most don’t see which consists of angels and demons, and the reality of the spiritual realm.  I say most don’t see because Mary, Joseph, the shepherds, etc…, all saw angels plainly.  Some of us can discern demonic activity, but to see it, is rare.  I have seen into the spiritual realm after an attack on my faith by the Enemy to turn from Jesus and serve him only once. But the Devil is real, and John 10:10 tells us that he desires to sabotage us and ultimately kill us in every aspect of our lives, mentally, spiritually, emotionally, relationally, and even physically.  .

In Rev. 12, the child is born the women escapes and the story continues like this:

“Then the dragon was enraged at the woman and went off to make war against the rest of her offspring–those who obey God’s commandments and hold to the testimony of Jesus.  We are the rest of the offspring that obey God’s commandments and hold to the testimony of Jesus.  From the spiritual realm we can now see the Christmas story from a much different lens, a lens that most don’t look into and don’t desire to do so, but it is still there and it is the spiritual realm that governs the natural realm and therefore worthy to be recognized.

Application: Do you realize there is more going on then meets the eye?  Do you know how to fight spiritually?  How are you responding to His birth spiritually, apart from the physical food, tress, and lights? Read Rev. 12 again and also Eph 6:10-17 and mediate on it.  What spiritual changes is God calling you to make at this time? Are you making them?

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Even if you are often alone, desperately trying to help your loved one, find and indulge in activities that sooth you and give you peace. You will regenerate strength to persevere for your loved one and help other family members meet their needs as well. I believe that God gave us each other, so that no one need ever walk or cry alone. Dinny Lawrence in her book,  “I Promised God”
“Then cometh Jesus with them unto a place called Geth-sema-ne, and said unto the disciples, Sit ye here while I go and pray yonder. And he took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebe-dee,and began to be sorrowful and very heavy. Then said he unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful, even unto death; tarry ye here and watch with me.” Mathew 26:36-38
There are times in your Christian walk that you are going to be lonely and at times, you are going to cry. Great as this word of ours may be, it is also full of tribulations. Jesus said, “In the world, there is tribulation.” There are things that will strike us directly or indirectly and will cause pain. There are our loved ones that will be affected in some ways that will cause us pain. False accusation, hate, abuse, discrimination, loss of any kind etc. will no doubt leave anyone distraught and torn. When such times come around, and the will, one of the most important resources you need is someone or some people to walk and cry with. You need a good friend, brother or sister, pastor. workmate, neighbor to help you whichever way so you can manage better and stand. The Bible says that, “Two are better than one.” You need somebody who loves, cares, is compassionate, dependable, trustworthy; a friend you can confide in. That could be your spouse, child, or parents. It could also!  be a “far away friend” but a ‘friend ‘indeed’.
I have, for example a good friend of mine in Germany. We don’t get to see each other that much. Yet we are so close. We share intimately and we encourage one another. We have cried together tears of joy and tears of sorrow. We call each other and talk sometimes for hours, sharing and building one another. We pray and laugh a lot at times. My wife and children are the closest and dependable, ‘walkmates and crymates’ in all seasons of life. I have other people, so many I cannot name all of them here, that have helped me in my Christian walk and made it manageable and bearable during difficult times. What about you? Do you have circles of ‘walkmates and crymates’? If you do, treasure them and develop close relationship with them. If you don’t, start now to build close relationship with few carefully chosen people to be your closest ‘walkmates and crymates’. You will need them!
Christ, our Lord and Savior, was self sufficient but he needed his closest friends to walk with and cry with when his heart was sorrowful to death. He did not choose all his disciples to accompany him during the last few hours of his pain and agony in Gethse-mane; he picked only three, his closes “walkmates’ and who on this particular night had to be his ‘crymates’. You too need someone. If Christ had need, we do too. Never walk or cry alone! God bless you. Brother Boaz Olang

title.rendered: The secret of living a happy and victorious life

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: everywhere and in all things, I am instructed both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need. I can do all things through Christ which strengthens me.” (Philippians 4:12-13)

Life has many seasons. All Christians have to live through all the seasons of life. Some seasons are easy, others are short and some are more desirable and pleasurable than others; there are also very tough seasons that come around often. How do you deal with all the seasons? Are you prepared to weather all the seasons? What do you need to do to maintain a state of happiness, joy, hope, peace, especially during the difficult seasons?

The key to living happily, successfully and victoriously during all of life’s seasons is adaptability. If you want to be happy, joyous and victorious, you must learn how to adapt to any situation or circumstance and fit in. Situations, things, people and places will not adapt to fit in with your wishes. Anyone who can adjust and fit in any life’s season has discovered the secret of personal victory at all times in all places and in all circumstances.

The author of Philippians learned how to be happy and content in whatever state or place he found himself in. Full or not full, he still managed; hungry or not, life was still great; rejected or accepted, he still had his dignity and courage to go on. It did not matter what life seasons dealt him, he, “learned how to adapt and manage his affairs-happily and successfully. Where did he get all the strength from? From Christ. His faith and confidence was in Christ. He recognized that Jesus Christ was his source of strength and satisfaction. He knew that no matter what he was going through, Jesus was there to help him pull through and come out victoriously on the other side. He knew that the difficult seasons would not last forever. He looked forward to a better tomorrow. And so, he wrote,

“I can do all things through Christ which strengthens me”

Friend, you too can do all things through Christ. All you need to do today is, “change your attitude and overhaul your belief system.” Begin to enjoy whatever season of life you are in right now. It may be painful, disappointing and very tough to endure. Tell yourself that you can make it-not alone, but with Christ. He is the Rock of your salvation and your helper. Stand on His promises. Walk in His ways. Put your hands in His hands and let Him lead the way. Look up and cheer up. Let this week and season be one of the best ever for you. Refuse the lies, intimidation and ridicule of the devil. Remind him of his demise and of your victory. Be happy! Smile! God bless you. Boaz

title.rendered: Responding To His Birth by Pastor Phil

content.rendered: Good morning, Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying, ‘Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace to men on whom his favor rests.’ When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has told us about (Lk 2:13-15).” “The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told (Lk 2:20).” “After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi [kings, astrologers] from the east came to Jerusalem Mt 2:2 and asked, “Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him…. they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts (Mt. 2:1-2, 11)” “Herod was furious when he learned that the wise men had outwitted him. He sent soldiers to kill all the boys in and around Bethlehem…. (Mt. 2:16).” When we talk about the birth of Jesus, we often hear stories of the angels, shepherds, and wise men that came to worship Him. Different ones had different responses to the birth of the Savoir. Let’s take a quick peak at each one, and see how you would have responded. First, we meet the angels. We know that the angels in heaven cry out for all eternity to each other “Holy, holy, holy is the LORD Almighty; the whole earth is full of his glory.” Angels are created beings and don’t have to submit to God and worship, as Lucifer chose to do. One third of the angels rebelled in this way, but two-thirds of the angels are still serving their Master. Heaven rejoiced at the birth of the new born king, and also rejoices over one sinner that repents. Hence the Savoir came to save sinners, and when He was born into the world to do just that heaven rejoiced, and when Jesus saves another sinner today heaven still rejoices! Secondly, the shepherds also responded to the birth of Christ with rejoicing as well. Shepherds however were the outcasts, the lowly of society, yet God saw fit to bring the outcasts to Christ. Perhaps God wanted the shepherds to meet the Shepherd of their souls (see Psalm 23 and John 10). Thirdly, there was another group that was lead to the Christ child, called the Magi. These were kings from the east that claimed “we have seen his star in the east and have come to worship him.” The magi were the same dream interpreters/astrologers mentioned for the first time in the book of Daniel. No wonder God lead the astrologers to Christ via the star, and warned them to return another way through a dream to as to keep His Only Son safe. The Kings from the east made a far journey and offered their gifts as they worshipped the King of Kings. Lastly, there was one who was both fearful and angry at the birth of the new born King. Josh McDowell comment, “King Herod’s reaction, though, was not one of worship, but one of worry and fear. He was afraid that Jesus, the newborn king, would grow up to overthrow his kingdom, so he did something awful. He had all the boys in Bethlehem murdered. Of course, God did not let Herod win; He protected His Son from Herod’s brutal action so that Jesus could complete His mission as our Savior.” Application: How do you respond to Jesus? Are you in worry /fear, like Herod, or in worship, like the angels, shepherds and wise men? Even though some people around you may not love or understand Jesus, ask God to help you worship Him with all your heart.
