title.rendered: ARE YOU EQUIPPED AND PREPARED FOR BATTLE WITH THE ENEMY?

content.rendered:
Good morning,

All Christians everywhere are engaged in a grand battle with the devil and his demonic forces. Their ages, positions, race, color, profession, education or career, citizenship or affiliation to church or a denomination does not matter or exempt them from the constant, aggressive and bloody battle with Satan. The target of the devil is the whole person (mind, body and soul), because that is what we are made of (1Thessalonians 4:16). The battleground is the mind. The mind is where our thoughts are processed. Our choices and decisions are products of our thoughts. Our mind is like the CPU of a computer. When you destroy it, you have destroyed everything that we are and can be and nothing is left. “We are what we think.” (Proverbs 11:23) “We are what we eat; what we take in determines what we believe and how we behave and live.”

The Threefold battle Goal of the Devil
Satan has a threefold goal, which has never changed since (John 10:10). He comes to: kill, steal and destroy. However, Jesus goal is to give the believers life and give it more abundantly. (John 10:10) That is how Jesus summed up his and the devil’s purpose. Bible believing Christians are engaged in a serious spiritual warfare with Satan whether they realize it or not. Our ignorance about this battle is no excuse and will not exempt anyone from Satan’s attack. Are you equipped and ready to fight for your life? Many Christians are not equipped and are not ready to fight the spiritual warfare. Many believers live and play their Christianity as though there is no devil. There is evidence everywhere proving that we Christians are constantly under attack and many of us are bound to loose the battle if they are not careful and wiling to rise up and fight the right battle, the right way with the right weapons. Are you one of those who are determined to fight and win or are likely to loose?

We have too many casualties in the church today. Many people are wounded, depressed, sick, lonely, confused, and fearful, overworked, tired and stressed so much they cannot pray or praise the Lord. We also have many believers who cannot pray, read their Bible and meditate on it day and night as we are directed to do (Joshua 1:8). Too many of us have settled for a form of religion instead of genuine relationship with God. But Christianity is not a religion. It is a relationship requiring daily fellowship with the Lord and other believers; it is about witnessing to the world that Jesus Christ is Lord and Savior. Christianity is Christ centered; Christ is the Author and Finisher of Christianity. If you love and cherish the benefits that Christianity offers more than you love and cherish the Christ who provides those blessings, you have missed the whole purpose and message of Christianity. You should not love God because of the material goods he gives but for who He is and for one perfect gift He has given you-the free gift of salvation through His Son, Jesus Christ Our Lord and Savior. All other gifts, favors, opportunities, and good success in any area of your life, are all wrapped in the, “one perfect gift-salvation.”
Pressure, allurement and competition from the world have pushed the believers to seek more things than seek the Lord. Things have become the main agenda of most believers. The devils message is that, “the more you grab or get the better off you will be.” That is a lie. More is not better neither is bigger any better. The size, amount and type of whatever material possessions we have should not be the yard sticks for measuring how much blessed a person is. Position and possession may be indicators of God’s blessings in ones life. However, they should not be the ultimate indicators. Pursuit of money and materialism and pleasure has become the main occupation and profession of many Christians today, especially in America. We call it, “pursuit of success” and regard ourselves as moving forward, but in what direction?

What do we need to have and do to fight the spiritual warfare?
We must first understand the nature of our warfare. It is not carnal but spiritual (1Corinthians 10:3).
We must be strong and ready to put on the right and whole armor of God (Ephesians 6:10-18).
We must consistently use the weapons of our warfare wisely. They are mighty and powerful through God to the pulling down of every stronghold of the enemy (1 Corinthians 10:3). We have: defensive and assault weapons. The most powerful are: prayer (Ephesians 6:18), the Word of God (Luke 4:4-13), faith (Hebrews 6:6), the blood of Jesus Christ, our testimony or confession (Revelation 12:11), Holy Ghost power (Acts 1:8), and righteousness while totally depending on the Holy Spirit for strength and on the Lord to fight for us.
We must be brave and take personal stand, not easily influenced by others whose faith or life style is not compatible with ours.
We must decide not to do what we want to do so we can do what we must do. Our calling is not to please self or anyone but to please God. He alone is our reason for living and service.
Conclusion
Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God and keep His commandments. This is the whole duty of man… (Ecc.12:13-14).
No matter where you have been, you can begin again and win. Your past is not equal to your future. Your past failures are not final. You are more than a conqueror through Jesus Christ who has already conquered for you. God will give you victory! Amen. Walk with God today! Brother Boaz Olang

“when you look at the things around, they can get as complicated as you want them to get – and yet again are as simple as they already are…”

look at Christianity … look at the Bible … look at the scrolls they found in the dead sea …imagine stuff that happens in the spiritual realm … look at the secular history … look at the world around … They all surely seem confusing and highly complicated.  Well, frankly speaking, it actually is!

The WORD of God is a mystery.
There are trillions of unanswered questions that one can find in the Bible.
For that matter, the very aspect of FAITH is beyond the common understanding of a scientist, leave aside a common man.
The Lord Himself has said that there are certain details about Him that are yet to be disclosed.

Human mind has the capability / capacity of perceiving truth/news/history/science/logic/basically anything in a manner that works for the individual. If you were to dedicatedly let  your imagination go wild, you could possibly join the little league of distinguished gentlemen whose thesis’ do rounds in Coffee shops/ Parliament houses / marriage bureaus and are accepted in all Universities around the Globe.
The Question is not whether it is the TRUTH. The question is, “what is the source for all that is incorrect, and yet so popular in the World”.
My grand father often quotes the famous saying, “and idle mind is the devil’s workshop”. He isn’t a believer though. Please pray that He gets saved.

The point I am trying to make has nothing to do with the things of the world. They are not worth wasting your time upon. But inevitably when you are required to deal with them you may need WISDOM of divine nature. Do you have it???? Who is your HELPER?
Imagine the ancient universities – The disciples/students always stuck to their masters, because that is where all their knowledge download came from. They just couldn’t afford to miss any session, lest they miss something very important. Yes, you can always ask your friends to share the knowledge. But it isn’t quite the same as knowing it from the teacher Himself.
Jesus, after having accomplished the divine task went back to HEAVEN and sent us a HELPER. Mr Holy Spirit. The same Holy Spirit who was there from the beginning. He is now with us, to help us out in our every day life.

So, Who is your source of knowledge? Whom are you filled with?

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“…test and approve what God’s will is-his good, pleasing and perfect will”. Romans 12: 2 (NIV).

If you were to choose between the two: having your wish or doing God’s will, what would you choose?

Before you answer this question, you need to understand the meaning of the two words: wish and will and the difference between God’s will and man’s will. Failure to understand the difference will mean incorrect choice. And incorrect choice can result into a conflict, compounded with very severe immediate, subsequent or future consequences. Many people are victims of painful circumstances, frustrations, defeat, depression, confusion, worry, disappointment, failure, and losses, physical and emotional sicknesses etc. because of making incorrect and ungodly choices or decisions for their lives.

What is God’s recommendation? Note the word “recommendation”. God does not impose his will on anyone. He gives us his view, insight to his plans and his word to guide us in making choices. He also expects us to correctly, intelligently, and adequately use our mind to think and reason with Him about every choice or decision we are about to make regarding all areas of our life (Isaiah 1:18). Listen, for example, to what he says in the Bible, regarding making choices and reasoning:

“This day I call heaven and earth as a witness against you that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curses, now choose life, so that you and your children may live and that you may love the Lord your God, listen to His voice, and hold fast to Him. For the Lord is your life and he will give you many years in the land…” Deuteronomy 30:19 (NIV)

“Come now, let us (you and God) reason together,” says the Lord…If you are willing and obedient, you will eat the good from the land; but if you resist and rebel, you will be devoured by the sword.” For the mouth of the Lord has spoken”. Isaiah 1:18-19 (NIV)

These and several verses in the Bible clearly indicate and confirm that knowledge, reasoning and obedience to his voice, are paramount for making decisions and choices that conform to his will and ensures our blessings.

How then can we avoid confusing our wishes with his will? How can we avoid conflict between our wish and his will? How can we escape the temptation of conforming to the world’s standards instead of being transformed by the renewing of our mind by the word of God so we can meet God’s standards?

In life, whenever we are making any choices, we are either choosing God’s will or our wish. That is how life is set to operate. It is unfortunate that many people, including Christians, because of their ignorance due to lack of proper teaching and understanding the meaning of the will of God, do miss God’s best. In addition, confusion and error in judgment are major contributors  to missing God’s will.

We operate on wishes most of the time. God operates on his will at all times. We keep a wish list. God keeps a will list. Often, we express our wishes and in some cases insist on them when trusting God to provide for our need. But God insist on His will; it is His will that He approves and appropriates in the lives of His children. Nothing less!

“ Insisting on getting your wishes is a sure guarantee of missing God’s will, for God may grant or permit a wish, without approving of it, for He approves and affirms His will only”.

Why then do we often insist on our wishes? Why is it that often we let our wishes override the will of God? Why is it that when God’s will conflicts with ours, we choose and insist on our wishes? Why do we find it hard to say “Thy will be done” when God cannot give us our wishes? Why is it that we sometimes insist on having our preference and not God’s provision? If God is all knowing and is the supplier of all our needs, why is it  that we refuse, arrogantly, at times, to listen to God’s truth and be convinced so we can accept God’s will? How, then, can one know His will? Why do we often insist on our wishes so we can please ourselves and others instead of accepting God’s will so we can please him, first, and then ourselves? Pray that God will help you know and walk in His will. God bless you. Brother Boaz Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“And Enoch walked with God after he beget Methuselah three hundred years, and beget sons and daughters: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; (in other words, he did not die) for God took him (alive).” Genesis 4:21-24

The above passage of Scripture has a very important but hidden message. The message is, “Any ordinary person can walk with God every single day until the end of his or her life.” Walking with God daily is not very easy. Everyday temptations, challenges, difficulties, disappointments, uncertainties, frustrations etc. that believers encounter make walking with God more difficult and increases the chances and feelings of giving up and backsliding, temporarily or permanently. Not only do the things and circumstances that cause pain make it difficult to walk with God, but even those things and circumstances that are pleasurable and peaceful can make believers abandon walking with God. Usually people give up walking with God when the excitement following their salvation is slowly and steadily eroded by the trials and tribulations that accompany salvation and the everyday problems of life that are inevitable to escape. But, any believer can decide and be determined to walk with!  God-till the end. After all it is not the sheep who keeps and leads the Shepard; It is the Shepard who does the keeping and the leading. And we know that Jesus is the Good and Great Shepard of the flock He has purchased with His own precious blood. If you are his sheep, you can walk with God no matter what may happen to you or come your way.

I have been walking with God for approximately 28 years now. I got saved in 1978. When Jesus met me on the street of one of the worst slums in the city of Nairobi, Kenya and saved me, my life changed dramatically. Immediately my eyes were open and my heart filled with joy, praise and thankfulness to God for the greatest miracle I ever saw and experienced. My eyes were filled with tears of joy. I hated the life I had led before and I wondered what could have become of my life had Jesus not saved me that Sunday evening through a street preacher. I became a new creation; old things passed away and behold, all things became new to me (2 Corinthians 5:17). I have never felt so close to God and to heaven like I did in the next few hours, days, weeks and months following my salvation experience. I could literally feel God in me, around me and each day, walking with Him was not a struggle but a delight. Each day I put my hands into His hands because I learnt that, “The footsteps of the! e righteous are ordered by the Lord” as the Bible teaches. I had a lot of problems and needs, but they all seemed to me like they never existed simply because I put my trust in God. And sure he took care of me and answered my prayers whether for small or big needs and concerns. God walked with me and never let me down.

As I began to mature in my faith, a lot of challenges, problems, difficulties and even doubts began to hit me from every angle. Close friends and relatives hated my new found faith; they though that I had lost it and had become insane. Fear, confusion, worries etc. sometimes crept in and made me wonder what happened to ‘the Joy of my salvation’. Financial difficulties hit me. I lost my job three months after I got saved. On many occasions, I could not afford the very basic necessities of life. Sickness sometimes creped in, attacking children. At one point, in my second year in salvation, we almost lost our second born son to unknown disease that attached like thunder. Many  bad and discouraging things happened to me and my family in those early years. But God…He was so faithful in keeping, delivering and anchoring us in Him. Each day, He would pick me up and help me walk with him. As years went by, I grew stronger in faith and my prayer life was constantly transformed, ! more so by the challenges I faced everyday and the passion I had for communing with God and dependence on prayer for the ministry. I learned to depend on God and no one else. To date, that has not changed. I am still walking with God today, not so much because I am a stronger Christian but because I have learnt to wait upon God for strength for the walk and the race that is set before me. Isaiah 40:29-31 is one of my favorite passage of Scripture that encourages me to walk with God, no matter what comes my way. It reads:

“He gives power to the faint; and to them that have no strength he increases their strength, Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the young men shall utterly fall:
But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk and not faint.”

I am more determined today than ever to walk with God. How about you? No matter where you are or what circumstances and obstacles may be hindering you from walking with God, make up your mind, today, that you will walk with God like Enoch did until God took him. God has not changed. Enoch too faced many challenges in his life, I believe, but he walked with God. Don’t give up faith. It is the only best and necessary and valuable gift you have on earth. If you give up walking with God, who do you imagine can be and will be a friend like Jesus Christ? Who do you think will be trusted like the Almighty God, who keep his promises? Who do you imagine you will turn to when calamities strike and no man seems to have answers or solutions? And worse, who will let you into heaven when your time on earth is over if you give up God and stop walking with Him? Think on these things!. Enjoy your walk with God today and always. He is a good God. God bless you. Brother Boaz Olang

title.rendered: Ungodly Eyes Are Watching You, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“At this, the administrators and the satraps tried to find grounds for charges against Daniel in his conduct of government affairs, but they were unable to do so. They could find no corruption in him, because he was trustworthy and neither corrupt nor negligent. Finally these men said, “We will never find any basis for charges against this man Daniel unless it has something to do with the law of his God.” Daniel 6:4 – 5

In America when one makes the statement “Big Brother is watching,” one is referring to the “eyes” of the government keeping watch upon the people.  When you go into a store perhaps there are video cameras around that monitor the activity of the people in the store which are being viewed by someone behind the scenes.  In this same way the eyes of the ungodly are watching you!  In this passage of Scripture Daniel was being watched by ungodly leaders who like Jesus’ accusers, could find no fault in his life.  His conduct and government affairs were found to be with consistent integrity.  These corrupt leaders manipulated the king to sign a decree which would eventually be broken by Daniel.  How did Daniel respond to these ungodly watching eyes?

Keep keen awareness.  The Scriptures point out, “Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published.”  How did Daniel learn of this decree since this ordeal was a setup against Daniel?  Perhaps because Daniel too was in the place of leadership all the leaders were made aware of this fact.  Daniel kept a keen awareness of the news, laws, and events surrounding his exile.  By Daniel’s wisdom perhaps he made it a point to know the latest news and how it would affect his godly lifestyle as a godly leader in an ungodly land (Babylon).  Do you keep a keen awareness of the law, news, and surrounding events in light of how they will affect you?

2.    Develop a Habit of prayer.  Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God, just as he had done before.  Prayer to the Lord was not a once in a while event for Daniel, but a lifestyle that he implored three times each day.  How’s your prayer habit?

3.    Refuse to Compromise.  Daniel knew the decree was signed, and that breaking the decree to keep the law of God would result in being placed in the lions den.  Did a lions den defer, slowdown, or cancel Daniel’s living for his God in the face of the ungodly, NO WAY!  Daniel would rather die than to allow some laws negatively affect his relationship to the Lord.  Is there anything that causes you to compromise?

Ungodly eyes are watching you every day, but what are they seeing.  Are you keeping keen awareness of what is going on around you?  Are you developing a habit of prayer, and do you refuse to compromise your walk with God?  You can’t stop the world from watching you, nor should you try.  Rather shine brightly for Jesus and give them an eyeful!

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

James 1:4&5, “But let patience have it’s perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking nothing. If any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all men liberally and without reproach, and it will be given to him”

Nearly everyone struggles with what we call patience. In walking with God, I’ve discovered that God is never in a hurry to do anything, in fact He takes His sweet time developing something that He knows will last.

Patience is awaiting God’s timing without doubting His love and ability to do it. Patience is not caught or taught in a classroom, patience is learnt and mastered in the sea of life. I never had this couple of years ago but after sometime of going through some stuff, I began to master it as the life itself taught me how to live it. I can be very patient when I know that in the long run it will pay. I hear a lot even from Christians who say they have no patience in their lives in fact they are the type I would call “I know what I want and I want it now” and so when things are not done fast and the way they want it, they get frustrated. You can tell the impatient by what is coming out of their mouths, Luke 6:45, “…of the abundance of the heart, the mouth does speak”

The text given tells us to let patience have it’s perfect work, you cannot hurry patience and or dictate it as it is able by itself to do what it needs to do. The bible says that patience is one of the fruit of the spirit and so if you are lacking patience in your life, you are missing one of the most important fruit. Patience knows how to bring out the best of us when allowed to perform a surgery. It will do it’s own tests, discover the weakness and allow certain things to come our way to make us wait longer and the more we wait the more our attitude is adjusted. Patient people are never frustrated when things don’t go right and they don’t jump to conclusions for they know that with time they will see the reason why that had to come their way. Remember that patience will perfect and complete you whereby you will lack nothing only if you allow it to do so. Good illustration, when people flying in the plane, there comes a time when they know for sure that it’s time to land and on occasions you will hear the pilot announce a delay maybe because of weather, planes taking off or any other things that could hold them. You should see people’s faces when they are told this as they begin complain, murmur, saying “never to fly with this airline again”. Does this sound familiar? Some even begin to ask whether the plane has enough gas to stay in the air. I want us to know this morning that if God puts us on hold position, He has equipped us with enough gas to hold us up there. The landing is not denied, only delayed for the runway is being cleared. No need to be frustrated because you don’t have what you requested, your patience allows God to make the run way for your safe landing. Even walking with Christ requires patience, Hebrews 12:1&2 “…let us run with patience the race set before us looking unto Jesus the author and the perfector of our faith”. This goes even for calling into the ministry, as you wait patiently by the time you are called into ministry the more you will be patient with people that you will minister to. I received my calling 5years after I got saved and that was not easy to wait for but the good thing is that I had enough  gas to put me on hold position and when I landed, my runway had been cleared. I am still allowing patience to do it’s perfect work in me.

Now if you lack wisdom on how to be patient, ask the Lord who gives to all men wisdom liberally and without approach, and it will be given to you. You pray for patience you are asking for something you don’t know for in the next few hours, you will hit the heaviest traffic that will test your patience, that friend, workmate or boss will really test your patience. Don’t crush your plane simply because you were not allowed to land the time when you wanted to, know that God will equip you with enough to PUT YOU ON HOLD POSITION.

Thanks
Evans

content.rendered:
It is a very simple concept… Relationship with GOD!
All of us want it! All of us love to enjoy it! However most of us are either not able to relate to it or are not able to sustain it.
I am sure we all Love God. Conveniently! Now why do I say that! Let me explain.
On the 20th of June, 2005 something marvellous and extraordinary happened. I was married to Thrishna, the most beautiful woman on planet earth. I took the oath that I would stay by her through all the facets of life. And she took the same oath, too. I told her that I loved her, and I must have said that a million times to her, till today! And I know she loves me too.
Now, just imagine If I were to suddenly stop spending considerable amount of time with her / or say If I stop saying “I love you” or reduce the frequency / or if I stop displaying my affection towards her, through the usual gestures / or if I stop buying her gifts or other stuff  .. Then will not Thrishna obviously feel that there is something wrong in the relationship. I may insist that nothing is wrong, and even truthfully quote excuses of being busy at work or other matters, but the fact still remains that I am not fulfilling my role in the relationship.
A relationship is a two way thing. It actually takes TWO, for any relationship to get initiated and established. Before you start to think that I’ve put on the cap of a marriage counsellor – Let me clarify!! The idea was to bring to light, our conveniently shelved relationships with GOD the Father.
Yes, I am sure many of us have pushed aside our relationship with JESUS, to a convenient Sunday morning or a Saturday evening, or even worse mere conversations where God is discussed alongside earth quakes and plane high jacks. And we don’t even feel the absence of any excitement, because we have found so many worldly substitutes. And to top it all, we never heard God complain – Did we? So we naturally assume, it must be fine up there, with the MAIN MAN too.  Read on…
My spiritual mentor,  in one of his messages, once made an outstanding statement. He said, “God didn’t create Adam, because He needed a gardener”.  Dear oo Dear,  than what did He make us for…. perhaps to display His Majestic Power or may be to watch us love and fight and kill and puke around or may be because His full time job is to create. Now, Don’t you dare believe in all that worldly philosophy.

God loves you MAN. How else do I say it. He loves you more than your best friend could. He died voluntarily so that you don’t have to die. Can you beat that.
For those of you who are thinking out aloud, “Hey we know all that man.. we’ve been there .. tell us something new.. something that helps”.
Okay HERE YOU GO!
TALK to GOD! now… Just a Hello will do, but TALK TO HIM NOW… won’t you smile at your neighbour, if he comes across on the street.. Then how much more God.!
And then talk to Him again… a little later.. Tell Him that you love Him or something.. Don’t wait till Christmas.
Tell Him out either aloud or inside your heart, that you are thankful for all that He blessed you with!!
And then when you remember something new that you were blessed with, thank HIM again…
No harm in thanking HIM, out ALOUD…! He isn’t going to bite you.! Nor will your colleagues.! They’ll probably catch the bug, and soon everyone would be thanking HIM…!!
And then when you would’ve finished your day, start to chat with Him,, may be about how the day went. Acknowledge His constant presence in your life..  On your way home, may be you could sing Him a song.. a song of praise…!
Keep talking to HIMMM.. you may not realize but He is listening… and He is enjoying every bit of you…

p.s.Establish that TOUCH POINT today.. and He’ll help you make it last forever!

title.rendered: Past Sins and Present Truth, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But he that lacks these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and has forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.  12 Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though you know them, and be established in the present truth.” 2 Peter 1:9, 12

In second Peter, Peter lists ten virtues that should be in the life of a Christian in 2 Peter 1:5 – 7.   Peter goes on to say in light of the virtues, “For if you possess these qualities in increasing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.”  He then points out that those who lack such virtues are blind and thus have forgotten of the cleansing of one’s past sins.  He then goes onto implore that the Christian be established in the present truth.  The past is a time that perhaps many would like to go back and change, but one cannot go back in time, that is why it is called THE PAST.  Peter teaches us some very important lessons concerning our forgetting past sins, and our living in the present truth.

God never wastes a pain.  Perhaps you, like I, have experienced some deep hurts from other people, and situations.  Who better to minister to someone that has been raped, then another believer that has been raped?  Who better to minister to someone that has been in financial crises, then someone else that been over their heads in bills and not knowing where the moneys were going to come from.  God will not waste your pain, but in submission to Him, He will use your pain to bring honor and glory to Himself through it.

2.    Living in the Past blinds us from living in the present.  God desires that we learn from the past, but not live in the past, there is a BIG difference!  How can one move forward in Christ, if one is still living in the past?  Remember when Israel wanted to go back to Egypt, the place of bondage, for the temporal pleasure of food?  Isn’t that just like some Christians at times, that choose would rather go back to bondage because of a temporal pleasure.

3.    Be established in the truth.  To be established is to have one’s “house” built firmly upon the rock of Jesus Christ, rather then the shifting sands of this world.  Our lives at one time were built up the sand of falsehood built by the enemy himself.  However God is calling His children to live in truth.  It’s easy to live a lie, by staying away from the truth which is found in God’s Word.  Jesus said, “Sanctify them by the truth; your word is truth.”  When one continues in the truth then one shows themselves to be a disciple of Christ (John 8;31), then the truth that one practices, puts into action, appropriates will set them free from the past.  God’s truth is described by Paul to be the belt that the belt is tied tightly around the waist to indicate that the soldier is prepared for action. To loosen the belt was to go off duty.  Are you established in the truth or do you go off duty at times? Are you in God’s word which sanctifies and washes (Eph 5:26)?

Remember that God is calling you and I to learn from the past and not live in the past.  He will never waste a pain, and will establish us in the truth by His Word, in His Word, and through His Word.  Then we are to take God’s truth and share our faith.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

God delights in the spiritual growth and total prosperity of all his children (3 John 2). That includes you. He, however, require us to take the lead and have a passion and higher degree of devotion, commitment, and total dependence on Him and His Word, for our spiritual growth and prosperity. He has provided us with all the tools, resources and wisdom and the Holy Ghost to teach us all things and to guide us daily. Quite often, we choose deliberately to do things or live a life that will lead to personal spiritual decline and poverty. What are some of the things, choices, actions and lifestyle that are likely to hinder you from growing and prospering?
Being unequally yoked with unbelievers
Bewitching oneself like the Galatians did by starting in the spirit and ending in the flesh (Galatians 3:1-3)
Disobedience to God’s will (Word, ways, instructions, law)
Setting your affection on things (below) and being more devoted to improving personal ‘outlook’ than ‘up look’. (Colossian 3: 2)
Negligence and carelessness
Rebellion
Pride
Ignorance
What are some the likely consequences of our actions and behaviors contrary to God’s ways and will?
Spiritual and physical weakness
Worldliness
Spiritual retardation and death
Backsliding
Poverty and sickness
Negative emotions e.g. anxiety, depression, fear, hopelessness, faithlessness, distrust, pain, confusion etc.
What can you do to avoid or overcome the negative and destructive consequences?
Change!
Secondly, avoid any situations or making any decisions and choices that inevitably will lead you and lock you into spiritual poverty and which may eventually kill you.
We can never change anyone or anything without first changing ourselves. Personal change is a personal responsibility. You either do it or you don’t. Even God can only change one who is willing to be changed-for good.
There are conditions and requirements for spiritual and personal growth. If you truly and honestly want to grow and prosper, you need to take quick and decisive actions. Do the following:
Repent of any known sins including carelessness, laziness and negligence
Delight yourself in the Lord (Psalms 37:4)
Humble yourselves and pray and God will lift you up in due season
Seek ye first the Kingdom of God and its righteousness, and all these things will be added unto you (Mathew 6:33)
Love the Lord your God with all your heart, mind, body and soul
Divorce evil
Replace bad habits with good habit
Be consistent. Seek help and wise counsel when necessary
Don’t be in a hurry for anything. Wait patiently upon God.
Work hard and enjoy NOW what God has given you.

“The rest of the best are still in the nest.” God bless you.
Brother Boaz  Olang.

Good morning,

Luke 18:35-43, “… And he cried out saying, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

In order to receive the blessings, we nee to be at a place where the Master can meet us. The Master has a way of meeting us in our weakest, blinded, confusing times as He knows that without Him we can do nothing. The story in the book of Luke gives us a clear picture of a blind man’s life, we are not told of his name but we are given his condition. He is sitting by the road side where many do pass by. I believe this was his first time there. This must have been his usual place of begging everyday. I have felt many times that I am just in one place not moving any further and yet I had issues that I desired God to deal with. Testifying to the fact that he is blind, he is incapable of doing anything but to beg. How many times have we felt the same, begging people to affirm us, say nice things about us, begging for recognition, but those days are over. Jesus is on His way to Jericho when the blind man hears some noise, he begins to inquire on what was going on. He is told that Jesus Christ of Nazareth is passing by. Many people had passed by this place but there was something different about Jesus that caused this man to stop and think for a minute. I believe that he had heard the miracles Jesus had performed and so he understood that his miracle was just around the corner and so either now or never. He calls on Jesus, “son of David have mercy upon me” everyone is trying to calm him down but he cries the more. When you know that you miracle is just around the corner, no one can pull you down when your time to rise up and receive has come. People, situations and opinions may try and cause us to forfeit the blessings but that is the time we need to cry the more. Seize the moment, exercise your faith, call on Him, let your voice go beyond all the obstacles, stop Jesus on His tracks just for a touch.

Thanks be to God that after crying out, despite the multitude, His attention is on me. Jesus commanded the people who were trying to keep him down to bring him over to Him. I’m glad that when I pray, God uses my obstacles to bring me closer to Him. Jesus asked, “what do you want me to do for you?”. In as much as Jesus knows our needs, He still desires to hear us mention them before Him. The blind man said, “Lord that I may receive my sight”, he was specific, let’s be specific in our prayers. I love the way Jesus does it, He says, “receive your sight; your faith has made you well”. Have Faith in God, do not let the Master’s opportunity pass you by this day, SEIZE THE MOMENT. Read the passage in Luke 18:35-43 to strengthen what I have mentioned. I could break it down line by line but that could take pages of emails. I pray that this morning you will be blessed and encouraged as you go for all that the Lord ahs in store for you today.

Thanks
Evans

title.rendered: I have the Power – Part 2 by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mt 21:12 Jesus entered the temple area and drove out all who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves. Mt 21:13 “It is written,” he said to them, “ ‘My house will be called a house of prayer,’ but you are making it a ‘den of robbers.’

Jesus goes into the Temple and drives the money changers out, as if to say this also is mine.  He says this My house and it will be a house of prayer.  He started overturning tables.  This hardly sounds like “lowly Jesus meek and mild!”  Jesus seems more like the Terminator here!  He claims authority (power), and that authority (power) is even yielded to.  He was saying I have the power!  Why didn’t they just throw Jesus out, there were more of them, then there was of Him.  Maybe in part fear of the people.  Maybe because they thought, “don’t mess with this guy, He acts like He owns the place.”  No one opposed Jesus in his actions.  The Lord knows what belongs to Him.  His house was being used to break the Eighth Commandment, “Thou shall not steal.”  When Jesus walks into a situation, because He has the power He has a way of overturning situations.
When David stood before Goliath God overturned the current heavyweight champion and David won the battle and thus the victory.
When Joseph was sold into slavery, God overturned the situation and Joseph became second in command to Pharaoh in Egypt.
When Daniel was thrown into the lions den God overturned the situation; instead of Daniel becoming lunch for the lions he was completely unharmed because he refused to compromise in his prayer life.
When Moses, armed with a shepherd’s staff, opposed Pharaoh in Egypt God overturned the situation and sent the ten plagues and set the Israelites free.

When the blind, lame, deaf, and hungry came to Jesus, He met their need in healing, in food, in hope.  When Lazarus was dead Jesus overturned death and brought.  When you and I were lost in our sin and on our way to Hell, Jesus overturned the path we were on a ripped us off the road to Hell and dropped us off on the highway of holiness.  When the power of the Lord comes into a situation, or circumstance, even during impossible time His can overturn the situation in your life. Keep praying, keep holding on, keep hoping, keep serving, keep believing, keep on keeping on, because Jesus has the power to overturn things to accomplish His will in on lives no matter the obstacle at hand.

Until the nets are filled…

Blessings,
Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Have you ever uttered the words, “I don’t care” to anyone? or has anyone ever told you in your face, “I don’t care”?

I have said those words many times, sometimes to those whom I love and should care about simply because I was either annoyed with them for whatever reason. Equally, people have slashed me with those words, at times, when I needed their care and compassion most. Those words can hurt others when you say them and are also sure to hurt you when you receive them from anyone.

So, is there someone who really cares for you for life no matter what happens or what you do or don’t do? Is there someone who will love you and provide for you during your greatest hour of need? Yes there is; but he is not who you think. There is only one, and I mean one, who cares for you as if you are the only one best thing that ever happened to him. He loves you at all times and is forever there for you and ever willing to carry you through to the other side of your needs or problems by providing you with everything you need for living blessed and victorious life. His delight in in giving you the desires of your heart (Psalms 37:4,25). He has plans for your future and wants you to patiently wait for the realizations of those plans (Jeremiah 29:11). He wants you to have not only success but good success (Joshua 1:8); He also wants you to prosper and eat the good of whatever land you are in right now if you be willing to do so and be obedient to his voice (Isaiah 1:19). H! e cares enough that he wants to provide all your needs according to his riches in glory (Philippians 4:13). Most importantly, he loves you so much he wants you to spend eternity with him in paradise when your time on earth is up and also to reward you richly for your labor here on earth (Revelation 22:12) What a friend that is!

His name is, “The Lord God Almighty, the Father of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, The Great I AM, The Eternal God, Jehovah Jireh, The God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, The King of Kings, Emmanuel, The Prince of Peace, The Good Sheppard, Healer, Savior and the Rock of Our Salvation, The Alpha and the Omega”. He is a lot more than I have referenced here. Go to your Bible and learn more about who he is.

He who is greatest than you and I and greater than all things visible and invisible and stronger than the strength of all mankind combined has declared that he cares for you and is inviting you to bring all your cares to him whether they be physical, spiritual, mental, social, financial, relational, or whether you have need for wisdom, knowledge, comfort. patience, ability to endure or power and passion to pursue and accomplish personal goals at work or home or in career or ministry. It does not matter what the need is. The I AM WHO I AM says,

“Come to me all ye who labor and are heavily ladden, and  will give you rest” (Mathew 11:28).

Don’t you need rest? Aren’t stressed out at times if not often? Don’t you worry about your problems and concerns for the present time and for the future? Don’t you get scared and become afraid of the uncertain disasters and dangers that confront us daily? Don’t you sometimes suffer pain caused by diseases and sickness that constantly or occasionally hover around you? Don’t care about the needs and the hopelessness of the people  you love and care about most or least? I guess that you do care and that at times you don’t know what to do to avoid or avert bad situations or misfortunes or disasters that you may be facing. Well, you are not alone; You are one of many of us. Your dilemma, pain, lack or fears are not unique but common among saints and sinners. What then should you do? title.rendered: I Have the Power, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

When Pilate heard this, he was even more afraid, and he went back inside the palace. “Where do you come from?” he asked Jesus, but Jesus gave him no answer. “Do you refuse to speak to me?” Pilate said. “Don’t you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?” Jesus answered, “You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.” John 19:8-11

What comes to mind when you hear the word POWER?  Perhaps you think of your boss, a leader, a dictator, perhaps government comes to mind or some seat or position of influence.  What happens when two sources of power are standing face to face?  Think of two military forces in a battle to which there can only be one winner.  Jesus is standing in front of Pilate the governor of all of Rome and the issue at hand was one of power.  Pilate is walking in fear standing before Jesus and asks Him two seemingly daunting questions.  The first question had to do with Jesus’ place origin.  In pagan mythology, such as was found in Rome, the Olympian deities frequently consorted with men and women, and their semi-divine offspring, such as Hercules, had appeared on the earth and performed miraculous deeds. Hardened as he was, Pilate feared lest he should offend one of these visitors, that is if Jesus was one of there visitors.  Jesus’ answer to Pilate is SILENCE.  Why was Jesus silent?  Wouldn’t this have been a great time to share about whom Jesus was and His place of origin being Heaven itself?   The silence of Jesus, like his silence in the presence of Herod (Luke 23:6-11), meant that he could accomplish nothing with Him, because Pilate already acknowledged Jesus innocence.  Now the question remained if Jesus was from Mt. Olympus and was a god, who was greater in power Jesus or Pilate?

Jesus’ refusal to answer him angered Pilate, whose conceit and arrogance were shown by his following question: “Don’t you realize I have power either to free you or to crucify you?” He was insulted because Jesus had not shown him more reverence.  Pilate’s affirmation of his own authority is similar to a prisoner in a jail cell telling an officer that he (the prisoner is in control).  The weakness and indecision Pilate exhibited in this case shows this to be as such. Jesus, who could view the situation in its true light, knew that though Pilate had the legal authority (power) of which he boasted, he was really hampered by political pressures, and would eventually fold with the majority and show himself to be a follower of the people rather then the leader of them, despite the “washing” of his hands (Matthew 27:24) and proclaiming his own innocence just as he proclaimed his own power.  He was neither more powerful then Jesus nor innocent in the matter either.

Jesus looked on Pilate and now responds over the issue of power saying, “You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above.  This tells Pilate that even the power he thinks he has was given to him, not earned because of any of Pilates godlikeness or personal merit.  Pilate was simply an instrument in the divine purpose.  Jesus was saying in charge, but you aren’t running this event, but my Father in Heaven is orchestrating this whole thing from His throne.  Without a personal display of a miracle in the face of Pilate Jesus exercises His power over Pilate with His one powerful, bold, and absolute confident and truth statement.  Pilate can’t even control his own decisions or Rome.  Jesus was saying with full assurance yet without pride “You don’t have the power, I HAVE THE POWER!”  May we today be quick to acknowledge the power of Christ in our lives?

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

Acts 28:1-16, “But he shook off the creature into the fire and suffered no harm”

People in general desire acceptance, if you talk good things about them, one bad thing said about them has higher chances of changing the way they perceive things especially themselves. Let’s see it in our reading this morning, Paul and a few people have just survived a shipwreck by God’s grace. They have landed in an island called Malta and the natives of that island showed them unusual kindness as they saw how cold they were. They decided to make fire for them to help keep them warm. Everyone desires to be shown kindness wherever they go as that is a sign of acceptance. While keeping themselves warm, Paul went about collecting more sticks for the fire. One thing we need to remember is that whenever we are going to keep our fire burning for a long time, we have to keep gathering sticks and putting them in the fire. We have to keep on reading the word, praying, doing the work of the Lord in whichever place He plants us. If you have stopped doing any of this, before long, your fire is going to die. Keep on gathering sticks for your fire.

After gathering sticks, Paul began to throw them into the fire, suddenly a snake jumped out of the fire and fastened itself around his wrist. Boy that is bad news, a guy has just survived shipwreck and now a dangerous snake has coiled around his wrist? You put more sticks in your fire and you will be surprised about how many snakes will jump out of the fire to attack you. The more I serve the Lord, the more I get attacked and the more everyone is waiting for the day when I will curse, be discouraged, throw things and say that’s it. If you continue to read in vs. 4, “So the natives saw the creatures hanging from his hand, they said to one another, “No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he has escaped the sea, yet justice does not allow him to live”. Remember these people showed them kindness and now that there is a situation, they have changed their minds about Paul. I don’t know about you but one thing I know is that people can change their minds in seconds over one little bad thing that happens to you, no matter what good records you have had, one little mistake will override many if not all of your good works. You cannot live by people’s acceptance to make it in life, just because some people do not accept you for you are does not change God’s mind about reaching out to you. I don’t hear anywhere where God runs around looking for votes from people about whether He should bless you or not, you are the one who needs to forget those things which are behind and press on for the things which are before if you want God to bless you.

Paul already knew God was keeping him a live for something good, already he has survived the worse and so this one is no march. He shakes off the beast into the fire where it came from as he already knew the word, “These signs shall follow them that believe, in my name thy shall cast out devils, they shall speak with new tongues, they shall take serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall not harm them, Mark 16:17” . He does not care about what they think, He thinks about who cares for him. Everyone is waiting for him to drop dead and so are some who have called Christians fanatics. One thing happened in your life and many people are waiting to see what will happen to you, but you got to shake it off into the fire, shake off the pride, men’s opinions, confusion, frustration, bitterness, resentments, worry, doubts, brokenness. These are things that  are coiled around your wrist when you were adding more sticks to the fire. Don’t sit and analyze the snake and see what’s going to happen, shake it off at once.

The funny thing about the story, after the natives of the island waited for a while to see if Paul would fall and die, they saw Paul un affected so they changed d their minds about what they had thought about Paul earlier. Paul could have sat there to defend himself about not being a murderer but his actions proved he was a man of God. You can never change the minds of people about what they think of you by explaining to them but your actions will. What is it that is coiling around your wrist this morning, be of good cheer for it’s assign that your fire is burning. Shake it off!!!!!!

Thanks

title.rendered: The way up is the way down!

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 22:24, “…he is who is greatest among you, let him be as the younger…”

There is something about the Kingdom principles that cause us to see that God’s ways and the world’s ways completely opposite each other. The world promises peace when everything is going the right way, God promises peace even in the midst of chaos. The world crowns success, God crowns faithfulness. The world calls the qualified, God qualifies the called. He uses the weak things to confound the mighty and the despised to confound the wise that no flesh should glory in His presence.

Phil 2:5&6, “Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus, who being in the form of God thought it not robbery to be equal with God. But He made Himself of no reputation and He humbled Himself and became obedient to death even death of the cross”. Here is a man who has learnt what it means to serve and His service comes with humility. The disciples who had walked with Him still had the mentality of the way the world crowned things and so they come to the Master to find out who was the greatest among them. I bet they had collected some toys, had some success, felt more likeable, more accepted therefore they needed someone to tell them who was the greatest. Jesus’ reply “the greatest among you shall be a servant of all” These boys must have been crushed when they heard these words as they were not expecting them to come out like that.

We are called to be servants as that is how our foundation is built. When one begins to build a house, the first thing he does he builds a foundation and that involves digging going down. The deeper the foundation, the higher and the stronger the building can be. Jesus demonstrated it during the last supper, He girded Himself with a towel, went down on His knees and began to wash the feet of the disciple. The King of kings and the Lord of lords washing people’s feet? I am yet to see a greater leader or a celebrity go that low to do something like that. Jesus was getting ready for something extraordinary and so He wanted to humble himself and do what leaders wouldn’t do and not just leaders, but even the ordinary people. He says that if He could humble Himself to do it, how much more do we need to wash each other’s feet.

It’s easy to wash the feet of our friends, family and even people we respect. Jesus was washing the feet of a guy who will betray Him, another one would deny Him and the rest would abandon Him. We need to wash all manner of feet regardless of the race, religion, class, click etc. We are servants of God and so we do what we are called to do and how much a blessing it is to serve the Lord. We are not measured by what we have acquired, we are measured by how we have served.

Isaiah 40:31, “But those that wait upon the Lord they shall renew their strength; They shall mount up with wings as the eagles, they shall run and not be weary, they shall walk and not faint”. This is a verse that has been misinterpreted and I learnt what it means through a preacher who broke it down. Let’s look at the word wait. That does not mean sitting down and waiting for the Lord to come as though He missed the bus, it means serving as a waiter waits on tables meaning serving other people. The more you wait the more your strength is renewed and the more you will not get weary when you walk with Him. After Jesus had waited on His disciples, washed their feet, went on the cross, died and rose again, He is now highly exalted above all heavens and earth that at the mention of the name Jesus, every knee shall bow and every tongue shall confess that Jesus Christ is Lord.

Serve, wait and wash all manner of feet without complaining or murmuring, remember you are building your own foundation that will one day help you get up there. Charisma can put anyone one on top but integrity will keep him on top. Your faith, your patience, your view on people and humility are being built as you serve. The way up, is the way down first.

Thanks
Evans

This message is dedicated to those of us, who are in the midst of troubles. Not regular but  “Hard core / High Voltage / Never like before / Seemingly no hope / No way out/ heights of Persecution / feel like ending my LIFE”  kind of troubles.
Are you facing one such trouble in your life today. If yes, then this message is for youu buddy!
Before we even start dwelling deep in to the topic of troubles, let us understand a few things about our God.
1. God loves you no matter what your troubles are, and why they are!
2. God will continue to be faithful to you, regardless of your attitude towards your troubles.
3. Your Salvation isn’t dependant on your performance, in the midst of troubles.
4. You’ll not be denied entry into heaven just because you ran away from those God given troubles, instead of facing them.
5. His presence doesn’t depart just because you screwed up!
6. He is already waiting for you to repent, even before you have finished committing that sin.
7. He continues to be more eager than you are, to reconcile.
8. He doesn’t need you to do anything, other than repent, for you to be forgiven. You cannot earn His forgiveness by your good deeds!

Having got those elementary basics ready, let us go a little further to understand this troublesome topic better.
Troubles can be categorised into :
1.Self made
2.God designed
Now, how sure are you that your trouble is not self made. Immediately try and look back to ascertain the root cause of the trouble. Try and check if it involved you being disobedient to God to start with. Then check if you had wilfully broken any of His commands.
Having figured that, donot assume that God thrust those troubles as a punishment onto you. Its not correct!! God, in the first place wanted you to be obedient in order to avoid those troubles, that He foresaw. But you were too busy disobeying! Ignorance isn’t a great excuse any longer. Go on your knees out there and ask for as much wisdom as you need. Its for free!! It’ll help you figure /discern better.

Let us now look at the second category. God designed … [ God designed because they are specially created by Him to suit His purpose] Now these are allowed in the lives of His chosen ones. Those ones, about whom He boasts to the devil. There is a purpose involved. It is for His GLORY / for His NAME’s sake. He allows these based upon the individual capacity / tolerance levels of His saints. And IF you are in the midst of one such God designed trouble, it would be wise “SHUT UP and not ask any questions [no one asks questions, when God’s on their side], hold onto HIM and just enjoy the ride!!

p.s. by the way, regardless of which category your trouble belongs to, God is very well able to turn it into GOOD…

title.rendered: Expressions of a Thankful Person, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Happy thanksgiving everyone, be thankful today for the great things he has done. Ev

“He threw himself at Jesus’ feet and thanked him-and he was a Samaritan. Luke 17: 16

We are quick to complain and ask God for things, but slow to thank Him for the blessings already in possession and slow or non – existent to give thanks when He does answer prayer, provide, or protect.
How quickly we forget to thanks.  “Give credit where credit is due” how much credit does God deserve?  Do you treat God like a cosmic Santa Clause or a Heavenly Father?  I’ve heard it said that the Key to contentment is Thanksgiving.  For the Christian, every day should be Thanksgiving Day. We should even be thankful in the midst of problems. The Apostle Paul said in 2 Cor. 7:4 have great confidence in you; I take great pride in you. I am greatly encouraged; in all our troubles my joy knows no bounds., ” He knew that God was working all things together for his good, even though he was going through trials (Romans 8:28). And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose

Jesus encounters 10 lepers that ask Him to have mercy on them.  Jesus conforms to Jewish norms by requiring that the lepers go for the required priestly declaration of health (cf. Lev 14).  Jesus teaches about the expressions of a thankful person.  To give thanks is to show gratitude, give admonition, and let gratefulness flow out of your heart in words and in deeds and to express that joy Godward!  Here are some expressions to learn from a thankful leper.

#1 Thanksgiving BEGINS with Recognition (V.13).  All the lepers acknowledged Jesus as MASTER.  As you spend time with Jesus what are some names or titles you use to refer to Him as your recognize His rule over your life? Lepers were social outcasts that had body parts rotting away that would eventually fall off.  Perhaps there are areas in your life that seem to be “falling off” that you an’t seem to keep together.  There is no one that has it all together.   Maybe everything is not falling apart in our lives, but there are areas that each of us feels handicapped in.  We need to recognize God’s power and mercy (“HAVE MERCY ON US).

# 2 Thanksgiving CONTINUES with Obedience (V.14).  Upon asking for help from Jesus, He sent them to the priest and they obeyed Him.  As they were going (obeying) they were cleansed.  God does things in our lives as we are obeying Him.  He trusts us with a little and sees how obedient we are with what He has given us, before He will ever entrust us with more.  Jesus has commanded us to “GO” seek and save the lost.  What this command given be seen as obedience in your life?  Jesus said “if you love me, you will obey me” (John 14:21)

#3 Thanksgiving is FULFILLED in Praise (V.15-16) Only 1 / 10 returned to give thanks, and Jesus recognizes that.  The leper gave active thanks.  He didn’t send a postcard, or e-mail, no way, he thanked Jesus personally!  His thanks came from his loud voice (he was not ashamed) Rom 1:16.  He Glorified God (not the priest).  In Humility Feel he fell at the feet of Jesus) The world is unthankful “For although they knew God, they neither glorified him as God nor gave thanks to him, but their thinking became futile and their foolish hearts were darkened.

#4 Thanksgiving RESULTS in Spiritual Healing.  The Samaritan realized he was healed and “Made whole” which was not the same proclamation for the others. Jesus verbally recognized the man’s faith in the healing process, which could also be read, “Your faith has saved you”   More than physical healing, but spiritual healing.  This man got something the other nine didn’t receive because he gave thanks.  God may withhold future blessings from you when you don’t give him thanks, and recognition for what He has already done in your life.

Don’t forget to share the gospel with your family this Thanksgiving…It may be your last chance

Until the nets are filled…Blessings & Thanks, Pastor Phil

Good morning,

John 15:5, “I am the vine, yea are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me you can do nothing”.

Due to computer issues, my dad has not been able to bring yesterday’s and today’s message. I will cover for him today.

Where there is a start, there has to be a finish and where there is a beginning, there has to be an end somewhere Just because some people don’t make it till the end does not mean it’s not there. Someone said that it’s not a matter of how you begin the race, it’s how you end it that counts. I have proven this to be true as I do not hear much about someone who started great and ended poorly talked about but someone who might have not had a happy and good beginning but in the end built a legacy that we still look at even till today. The question is, should my beginning be great and my end be poor or should I not worry much about how I start but work towards my finish after it has been said and done?

Understanding who I am and my connection to God allows me to make it in life. Israel (Jacob) becomes a father of many nations, he’s beginning was very poor but his end left a testimony from the time he encounters with God to the time he leaves the earth. If you look at it carefully, he was actually bearing fruits. John 15 tells that we are called branches, our position is to abide and our destiny is to bear fruit, more fruit and much fruit. We are not expected to produce fruits as Christ is the producer while we bear fruits meaning just carrying the right fruits simply because we are attached to the true vine. Mark the way Jesus begins in John 15:1, “I am the true Vine…”, I believe that He knew that there were many other vines out there people could attach themselves to, this causes Him distinguish Himself from the other vines. We need to be identified by our new birth as we understand who we are in Christ and we begin to bear fruits not because someone somewhere gave as identity but because we have found a Master who knows how to define us. With this understanding, we are not limited to just what we have, but desiring to have more and much. Be it career, marriage, family, and ministry as long as you are attached to the true vine in other words being in His will, He will be faithful to do it. You and I are destined to make a difference wherever the Lord sends us, we are the salt of the earth, history makers, rich (materially, spiritually, emotionally). Your pew ought to change because you are sitting on it, your surrounding ought to shine because you are the torch of the hour. Since you are abiding in Him, He will allow you to bear exactly what He had destined for you in life. I don’t want to reach heaven for God  to show me things He had stored for me in this life that I never utilized simply because I wasn’t abiding like I should have. Hanging out with the wrong people and being in wrong places and associating with wrong things will hinder my fruit bearing, in fact that may stunt our fruit bearing, the bible says, “Choose your friends wisely” and Psalms 1:1-3 sums it up.

This is true” …for without me you can do nothing”, “Destiny is not a matter of Choice: It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved”  — William Jenning Bryan. Yes I started poorly as I was on my own, and being on my own caused me to mess up big time but when He came to my life, He changed my way of thinking, behaving, acting and dependence and now I am destined to abide in Him, for my abiding in Him defines my future and because He is the best in future making, my end will bring glory to His name and my testimony will touch many lives. Enoch walked with God, all He could leave behind was that He had pleased God, David walked with God that all he could leave behind was that he was a man after God’s own heart. My encouragement to all of us, how poorly we started is not an issue, how we will finish the race while abiding in Him will count, 2Tim 4:7, I have fought a good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith”

Thanks
Evans

Good morning,

“And he (Uzziah, who started ruling at age 16 and ruled in Jerusalem for fifty five years) sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God: and as long as he sought the Lord, God made him to prosper. (2 Chronicles 26:5)

Do you want to prosper? I don’t know about you, but I do. I do because I know it is GOD’S WILL FOR ME AS HIS CHILD TO PROSPER IN EVERY WAY. The Scripture says in 3 John 2, “Beloved, I wish above all things that you may prosper and be in good health, even as your soul prospers.” The prosperity God wishes for us to have is total, covering body, mind and soul not just material possessions. And God is faithful in granting prosperity to anyone who wants to prosper and are ready and willing to do his will.

If you want to prosper, aim high, start low and keep going, but most importantly, keep trusting and depending on God by constantly. Seeking him for worship and guidance in all that you do or intend to do.

Uzziah, the young king, discovered one secret of prosperity, “seeking God”. He sought God diligently and wisely, fellowshipping, consulting, and receiving guidance from men of God like Zechariah who had understanding in the things of God. And the Bible says that, “as long as he sought God, God made him to prosper. He became a great and famous king. He built great cities, great army and was very famous. He became strong economically, politically, spiritually, socially and he kept going strong in all areas of his life, and leadership.

Then, something tragic happened; he became a leaper when he became proud, self sufficient and abandoned God and the men of God whom he had depended on for counsel and support.

“But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up for his destruction; for he transgressed against the Lord his God…” (Vse. 16) While in the temple, doing the priestly duties he was not supposed to do, and having resisted the priests, refusing to listen to them, leprosy suddenly appeared on his face. He was then thrown out of the temple because the Lord had smitten him.

‘”And Uzziah the king was a leper to the day of his death, and dwelt in several houses, being a leper for he was cut of from the house of the Lord… and Jonathan his son reigned in his stead.” (Vse. 21)

Tragic failure, misery and death can follow great success. Poverty can suddenly come to anyone who has greatly prospered, because of abandoning God. Most of the time people have failed at the peak of their success. It is hard to succeed; but it is much harder to remain humble and Godly when overwhelmingly successful. Prosperity is great but without God, instead of being a blessing, it can be a curse. In your prosperity, you need God more than you needed him in your poverty. Don’t make the mistake of abandoning God like Uzziah did, when you have been helped and have prospered and become great and famous. Continue to trust in the Lord and worship him and love him with all your heart, mind, body and soul and with everything you have. God will continue to prosper you beyond your wildest dreams. He will exceed your expectations no matter where you are or what you are doing right now. Aim high, start low and keep going. The journey to the top of the mountain starts ! with the first step at the bottom of the mountain. If you had not started, start today to aim high. If you are already riding high in God’s prosperity, keep going, but watch that you do not become proud and self-sufficient, abandoning seeking and depending on God. Be prospered and may God bless you abundantly. Brother Boaz

title.rendered: My Brother Davin’s Testimony, By Pastor Phil (inspired by Davin Sessa)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Brothers, pray for us.” (1 Thessalonians 5:25)

My younger brother Davin is studying abroad in Costa Rica.  I pray for him, and God is hearing my prayers.  The following is a testimony from Davin.

“I went on a trip to Montezuma.  I could write a lot about this one, but I will keep it short.  If you remember, you can ask me more about this one when you see me. The ride there was an adventure in itself.  It was 8 hours; we took a bus, a ferry, and another bus.  I rode with 4 other kids.  The 2nd bus was a little rough b/c the “road” was terrible.  We sat in the very back of the bus and I definitely caught some air from some of the bumps.  Montezuma is not very big, but there area very nice waterfalls there that you can walk to, only 15 minutes away from our hotel/hostel (I am not sure what it was).  The whole town was only a block long, but it had most of the things you want; a convenience store, a bar, and a restaurant that was right next to the beach.  The first night, we just hung out.  My room was very nice and most of us hung out there the first night.  We had met up with the other half from our school there, so we had about 11 kids all together.  The next day was when things got a little crazy.

The day started great.  We bought some eggs and cheese from the store to make omelets.  We didn’t have a stove in the room, but we did have a coffee machine and a crock-pot.  We were able to make one egg at a time on the coffee machine’s hot plate; it was actually pretty good.  We also made some scrambled eggs in the crock-pot using an empty plastic bag that I had from a loaf of bread, but that took a long time to cook.  While they were cooking, my friend Andy and I went down the street and hung out on the beach and took some pictures.  There were some cool rocks that we climbed on but, I ended up cutting my foot pretty badly on one.  I limped back to my room and cleaned it up.  The group was just about ready to go the waterfalls, but I couldn’t leave just yet, so Andy and I stayed back.  I kept an eye on my cut all day, literally.  The group had left about 12 p.m., while Andy and I hung out all day.  At 9 p.m. it was dark and the group was still not back. We knew something was wrong and we looked for police.  We had no luck with the police, but we got a hold of the Red Cross.  They were an hour away.  The reason we were scared was b/c in order to get to the waterfalls, you had to cross a river, which was at least chest high, and it had a strong current.  With the rain all day, it became very dangerous.  The Red Cross eventually got there, but couldn’t do anything b/c they didn’t have enough equipment.  They would attempt to get them in the morning.  Our friends were trapped with only there bathing suits while it was cold and rainy.  Luckily, there were some firefighters from Spain on the same floor.  We told them what was going on and they went out with some locals who knew the mountain well.  They had to scale the mountain to safety b/c the river was too strong. They rescued them!

It seems that my bad cut was a blessing in disguise.  If I had not gotten cut, I would have been on the mountain and no one could have called for help.  Thank you to all who are praying for my safety, it is working.”

“When we work, we work; when we pray God works.” Prayer….it is working!

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: A Sure Cure For the Blues, By Pastor Phil (Inspired by Charles Swindoll – Elijah)

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Elijah was afraid and ran for his life. When he came to Beersheba in Judah, he left his servant there, But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die; and said, It is enough; now, O LORD, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.” 5 Then he lay down under the tree and fell asleep. All at once an angel touched him and said, “Get up and eat.”  1 Kings 19:3-4

The following is a message that I was deeply inspired by from Charles Swindoll’s book Elijah, about the time in Elijah’s life when he went from victory to depression.  Here are some great truths for us to learn:

Firstly, Elijah was not thinking realistically or clearly.  Who made the threat?  It was Jezebel not God that came against Elijah.  How was Elijah able to so boldly challenge 450 prophets of Baal, but yet this one woman caused him to feel so threatened and vulnerable to his core?  Often it’s the little things that we make bigger than God in our eyes that seem to threaten all that we hold dear, and all that we identify with.

Secondly, Elijah separated himself from strengthening relationships. Why did he get alone?  Often when one is depressed one tens to retreat to be by oneself, instead of connecting as one should, often one will disconnect at the time he or she so desperately needs others.  However when this happens others are pushed away and whatever encouragement others try to give, it is appreciated but not received or heard as much as it is needed.  One looks inward and refuses for a time to look outward.

Thirdly, Elijah was caught in the backwash of a great victory.  Often after a victory, often comes temptation and vulnerability.  Elijah previously battled against and proved that God NOT Baal is the true God that manifested Himself by answering by fire.

Fourthly, Elijah was physically exhausted and emotionally spent.  When we are in this state our spirit is affected.  We tend to drag, become sluggish, tired, weary in well doing, etc….

Fifthly, Elijah got lost in self-pity.  Have you ever had the “victim mentality,” whereby you blamed the world, “the system,” and everyone and everything else for your unhappiness?  The blame game has been played since Adam blamed Eve when he was questioned by God.  When we are in self pity, as far as we are concerned we are the only one with problems, and they are larger than life, even greater than the Lord.  God will not allow us to stay in self – pity if we are following Him, because He has too much for us to do, and to become to glorify His name in victory, and not in defeat.

God’s ministered to Elijah.  God allowed Elijah a time of rest and refreshment.  God communicated wisely with Elijah (v.9), and gave Elijah a close personal friend (v.19-21) ELISHA.

Elijah reminds us.  Let’s look up after the Lord graciously delivers us from our depression. Let’s look up when he allow us rest and refreshment following an exhausting schedule that has taken its toll on us. Let’s look up and thank Him when He gently and patiently speaks to us from his Word after we’ve climbed out of a pit of self-pity. Let’s look up and praise Him when He faithfully proved the companionship and affirmation of a friend who understands and encourages us. Let’s look up and acknowledge the Giver more than the gift.

Until the nets are filled…Blessings, Pastor Phil
