Good morning,

Philippians 4:13, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”

I have a short word for us this morning as I adjust back to my normal life. The above scripture has been quoted by so many including myself especially when it comes to dealing with some things that seams impossible to deal with. I would like to approach in different way this morning so as to get the meaning when Paul said those words. Lets back up to verse 11-13, “Not that I speak in regards to need, for I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content: I know how to be abased, and I know how to abound. Everywhere and in all things I have learned both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need, I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”. If you look at this scripture carefully you see a lot of learning and surviving that causes Paul to be victorious in the end and he looks at all that he has been able to survive and he says he can do all things through Christ who strengthens him.

I believe that the greater thing you can do through Christ who strengthens you is what you can survive. When you can be content with the little that you have and trust God for more, be calm in what other people are freaking about and even learn to be full and be hungry, learn to keep your coolness under frustrations, learning to share the little you have, learning to let go of certain things. In short being able to deal with everything that should destroy you and you refuse to be destroyed by them, you can confidently say I can do (go through) all things through Christ who strengthens me. Greater testimony comes from what you have survived and not what you have achieved. What you have survived has a lot of teachings compared to what you have achieved. I am more grateful for the things I have survived for they were eye opening and they brought out the best in me cause I realized that if I can go through this and come out victoriously, I can go through something else because that the same God who was with me when I went through it is the same God who will be with me when I go through this.

I know we quote this scripture many times based on what we want to do, I would like to quote this scripture this morning based on how I can survive simply because I can do it though Christ who strengthens me, I see Paul writing that line because of what he had survived and will survive.

How I pray that just like Paul we will learn how to deal with different situations and circumstances that we may confidently quote Phil 4:13. Blessing Ev

Good morning,

“And upon the first day of the week, when the disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached to them, ready to depart on the morrow; and continued his speech until midnight. 8 And there were many lights in the upper chamber, where they were gathered together. And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus, being fallen into a deep sleep: and as Paul was long preaching, he sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and was taken up dead.  Acts 20:7-9

Perhaps you are all too familiar with this famous American nursery rhythm:

Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall,
Humpty Dumpty had a great fall.
All the king’s horses,
And all the king’s men,
Couldn’t put Humpty together again.

When meditating upon this nursery rhythm I wondered why this egg (Humpty Dumpty) was sitting on a wall to begin with.  Also why were the kings horses and ings men expected to put him back together?  Perhaps the One that should have been summoned with THE KING!  This story seems to parallel the account in Acts 20, whereby a young man by the name of Eutychus also had a great fall, except from sitting upon a window sill instead of a wall.  Perhaps Eutychus had some good excuses for dozing off:

Paul’s sermon was long.

2.    The many lights no doubt made the room hot. When

3.    He was a young man staying up until midnight.

4.    He was “overcome” by sleep.

When you hear God’s Word are you lulled to sleep or awakened by its truth.  If the stale air of this world’s influence makes us sink into a sleep of apathy, we must seek refreshing from the presence of the Lord.  When God’s Law was lost and the n found in the days of King Josiah, he read it for the first time and it awakened him so much that he called all of Israel to follow its commandments.  It is the midnight hour. We sit on the window of eternity. We can fall into eternity in a heartbeat.  Seek the Lord while He may be found when times of refreshing come from the presence of the Lord. When our Christian life seems to be a dry and lifeless sermon without end, and the joy of feeding on God’s Word is no longer in our hearts, we must get on our knees and return to our first love.  Many “go to all of the Kings horses and all the kings’ men,” by Jesus the KING is calling His people to seek Him.  “If my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then will I hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and will heal their land.” blessings Pastor Phil

Good morning,

Mathew 27:50-53, “And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice, and yielded up His spirit…and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised”.

We have been allowed an awesome opportunity to experience a life of Christ centered, a life full of hope, a life full of completion and fulfillment. I have never at any time regretted to have come to Christ for I got more than I bargained for. He received me as I was and He has never left me since then. Even before I knew Him, He was working in my life right behind the curtains. I owe it all to Jesus!!!. As I continue to walk with Him, I am realizing that He is more than a Savior to me for He is also the Lord of my life. Any time you talk about the Lord, you are talking about someone in charge, leader and provider.

As the Lord of our lives, He has shown us how much we need Him and how He will always be with us. If that is not enough, He has allowed us to bring things before His throne that have no value that we may receive what He has set for us that has value. In my text today, Jesus has just been crucified on the cross, He has just paid for the last sin when He said it is finished and He cries out with aloud voice and dies. Before His death, there were so many saints that had died and were still dead before Jesus died but the moment Jesus died, the graves in Jerusalem of the saints opened up and the saints were raised. Jesus has just traded places with the people who were once dead. He died that we might live, He traded places with us that we might become victorious. We traded the mortal for the immortal and that was the greatest trade we could ever make. With that kind of trade, we have now a greater opportunity to trade in what we’ve got for what He has. Remember that whatever we are trading in has no value but He is still willing to take it in. I know that people usually trade in cars to get newer versions, bigger than what they have, something more impressive and the dealers will look at what they have and take it as down deposit for the new car once they figure out the value. With Jesus it’s different, you bring in what you have and He will give you something better at no cost for it was already paid for on the cross. We could not come back to life until He traded places with us.

Mathew 11:28, “Come me, all ye that labor and are heavy laden and I will give you rest”, We see the Lord asking us to trade in our weariness for the rest. Many are not willing to let go of their life sucking stuff and therefore they hang on to what they shouldn’t be hanging on to, that results to no joy, no peace, no hope. I thank God because He is willing to take my condition and give me rest. I’m trading in my weariness for the rest in my spirit, my body, and my mind.

Isaiah 53:5, “He was wounded for my transgression, He was bruised for my iniquities, the chastisement of our peace was upon Him and by His stripes we are healed”, He became what I was that I might become who He is. I was the one who was wounded with a lot of sin, memories, incidents and accidents and with that He chose to suffer the afflictions for my sake and again I see that He was bruised and punished for my sake that He may trade places with me. What an awesome God working hard for us fallen people and with compassion to save us and not only save us but also heal us. We are healed because He was wounded. I’m trading in my sickness for His healing power.

2Cortinthians 8:9, “For ye know the grace of Our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though He was yet rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, yet through His poverty might be rich”. He became poor and rejected that we who are poor spiritually, mentally, emotionally, materially may be rich through Him. I wonder many times why I am holding to something that is sucking life out of me that I could trade in. Trying to fix something that I cannot fix, holding on to something that keeps on breaking and all I am doing is getting frustrated and going no where. We need to start trading in what we’ve got for what He has. Trade in your sorrows for the joy of the Lord, brokenness for wholeness; fear for courage and boldness; junk for worth; sickness for healing; bondage for deliverance; lack for provision; sin for purity; loneliness for companion. All that we are trading in have one thing in common, they are killers and they are not from God. John 10:10, “The thief cometh not but for to steal, and to kill and  to destroy, I am come that they might have life and have, and that they may have it more abundantly”. We have the enemy’s mission statement and we have the Lord’s mission statement, I am trading in the enemy’s mission statement for the Lords cause I can’t continue living under the junk from hell. Lord I have come to trade in what I’ve got for what You Have. TRADE IN NOW!!! Blessings Ev

title.rendered: What makes you burn? by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.  And they said one to another, ‘Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures (Luke 24:31 – 32)?’”

What makes you burn inside and really come alive?  What is that sporting event that you shout for your team?  I can reference all the Yankee fans here in NYC that screams when the Yankees play and beat their rivals the Boston Red Sox, even though it didn’t happen this year.  Would you come alive if you got that raise at work, or as lawyer won that case or perhaps you were a salesperson and made a big sale?  Hiking, swimming, hobbies, computers, dating someone, etc… are some various things that bring life to people.  Perhaps the thing that make you burn with enthusiasm and life was not on the list, but you know what that thing is that makes your heart race.  In this passage the thing that made hearts burn, and really come alive was the words that Jesus spoke.

This is the passage of Scripture occurs between the resurrection and the ascension, in the 40-day span of time that Jesus has been raised from the dead, but not yet ascended to the right hand of the Father.  The women go to visit the tomb that Jesus had been placed in and they find it vacant.  They run and tell the disciples and Peter’s feet couldn’t move fast enough to get to the tomb and discover the truth of the women’s news.  And they made their way back to where the rest of the disciples and were reminiscing along the way as to their hearts burning while Jesus talked with them by the way (on the road) and when He opened the Scriptures to them.  These had a zeal for the very words of Christ.  I asked what makes you come alive; now let me ask you, do the Scriptures make you come alive?  Is there a burn in your heart as God speaks to you through them, as you discover something new in that passage you’ve read many times before, and if not why not?  The early Christians are not really so different from us.  At one time it was tax collecting for Matthew, bringing in the big catch for the fisherman, and healing that last patient for Luke, that made these men burn with life.  But now, I believe that those temporal things were superceded by the life of God’s word, as there hearts burned at one time for the temporal, now they burned for the spiritual.  Jesus said, “My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work,” Because it was Jesus’ sustenance.   Where is God’s will found, but in His word.  Christian where is your burning heart for God’s Word?  If reading these devotions, and Sunday morning church, or mid-week Bible study is all your time in God’s word, then it’s obvious that you’re not reading for yourself, only being spoon fed by others.  I believe it was Charles Spurgeon who said, “Some of you have so much dust on your Bible that you could write the word damnation with your finger.”

Think about it, the hearts of the disciples burned for His word so much that we have four gospels to tell of the things they had seen and heard as reliable eyewitnesses of Jesus.   Click on and check the Barna site http://www.barna.org/FlexPage.aspx?Page=Topic&TopicID=7, which shows statistics on Bible reading among Christians.

Why is there testimony not the testimony of believers today?  I too get excited about some temporal things, but it does not compare with my excitement over spiritual things.  Think of Jeremiah who said “I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.”  He tried to keep from preaching God’s word but like trying to throw gasoline on a forest fire, the flames in his heart blazed out and he had to preach what was in him, because he couldn’t put a lid on it!  God was the consuming fire with Moses on Mt. Sinai, “For our God is a consuming fire and a jealous God Wherefore we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us have grace, whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear: (see Duet 4:24, Heb 12:28-29).”

Application:  Are you consumed?  Does your heart burn like Jeremiah, like the early church?  Is your Bible your daily bread that you are enthused about?  If so keep it up, if not I challenge you to read at least 15 min a day, record what God is saying to you, and obey what you read.
